QQZ4Aw4KZc4P-gvkdmoabw.text: It smells delicious as you enter the place. Which reminds me, the front door is a bit confusing. I was seated immediately. The nice young man took my drink order and promptly brought it to me. I ordered shrimp vermicelli salad. I was brought, what I couldn't tell was chicken or pork. The meat was very dry and I only got two small dry shrimp. Oh well. I'm easy I will eat it. It tasted great the fish sauce served with it as tasty also. I asked for the "chili tray" you know that thing you get in every other   Vietnamese or Thai restaurant. She nodded and came back with chili oil. I used it, but my dining companion asked if they didn't have any more a a selection of chilis?  She returned with a cup of dry chilis and a cup of chili paste and took the chili o away walked behind our table and slammed the dishes into the tray. Wow. It's just chili sauce folks. It's s usual condiment. We didn't ask for anything unusual in my opinion. Not sue if I would eat here again. The food was tasty but not outstanding.

jj0GjZE6ZlFhQtR86ulthA.text: This little non-descript (from the outside) place is a bit hard to find the first time since it is discreetly tucked in the back of the shopping center. It is a good thing I was going with a group of people who had been before, or I am not sure if I would have found it.     The spring rolls and soups are great here...as are the various noodle dishes that I've tried. I love Thai food, but I usually try something Vietnamese just to get  something that isn't readily available at some of the other Asian restaurants that I like.   It is certainly not a fancy place, but if you want really good food at reasonable prices,  you should give it a try.  I have now been back on a couple of occasions and generally find the service to be as good as the food.

do6YOQFKmx-9iRuVvwPa2g.text: So I love Thai food!  Take this with the grain of salt considering I only order Pad Thai and curries.  Yea, yea...I should branch out...but it's so difficult when you like something so much.  So how does the Viet Thai Noodle House stack up?  I had the Pork Pad Thai and was very pleased.  It was definitely different from the Pad Thai I've been accustomed to...but I usually get beef...so maybe the pork threw  me off.  Anyhow, a friend and I both ordered the same dish with a hot rating of 3.  I couldn't have loved it more...perfect amount of heat for me.  I do however...really enjoy heat...so a 3 may not be a great idea for someone new to Thai food.  Next time I'll try a 4...but it scares me a bit.  The inside of the VTNH was exactly what I expected...well...except for the fish tanks.  The decor and atmosphere are casual and simple.  It's not a five-star experience...but I haven't had better Thai food in years.  I will definitely be going back...in fact...I'm wondering if lunch and dinner at the same restaurant on the same day would be crossing the line.  Try:  The Pad Thai  (The Pho looked good...but I didn't try it)  Avoid:  Finding this place on your own...ask a friend or call the restaurant for directions.

MLWmvB1k5Ysuci4zowenDQ.text: Excellent,   every time I am hungry and on this part of town, its never a question ! ! !   The Chicken Drunken Noodles is the best ! !!    Fresh Rolls are always FRESH !   who can ask for better ! !    unless you are in Thailand,  BUT  That gets expensive !  lol

lAQwKPYg-p9j5xkAINuA5g.text: Papaya salad is delicious when it's spicy (my opinion)! So do try if you can take spicy. I don't like the shrimp that comes with it so my husband always eat them for me. They're not the dried tiny shrimp. but a cooked ones.  Pho combination was pretty good too.

0FqIypugAnQu-H6lL5dlKA.text: This place is so great! I eat here every weekend! :) pho is good. Spring rolls are yum. Everyone was nice and friendly.  If I don't have time to sit and dine, I order to take out. :)

3n4zfY1CLu0MvudklEzVOg.text: The Pho here is delicious and the service is fast and friendly! Broth had tons of flavor and they didn't skimp on the noodle / meat portions. Great value!

8UHjLe3a-NaeYzSE17il3w.text: Stopped by to try their bubble tea. Pretty good stuff...I got the green tea with tapioca pearls in it. Place was empty which meant fast service. Delightful staff will stop by again when I'm in town.

aKAR8QLX31bGNvmJy2n8Pw.text: Last night I totally could have been mistaken for an anime character at the rate and gusto I was slurping up my seafood pho.  Embarrassing as it was, it was so worth it.    Our original dinner plans fell by the wayside so we drove over to Viet-Thai and I was super super hungry.  The funny part about it is that our group of 3 ordered the same thing, but we all had different sizes... My mom opted to go with the medium... My uncle opted for the large, and I took the "papa bear" size XL.....  Service was good.  You can really feel the effort and care that the owners/servers had for the place.  Probably not the most efficient and fast place, but I think the additional "down time" help add to the relaxing ambiance of the dining room.  Really there is something to be said about taking your time to eat versus the fast food (drive-thru window) mentality.  Can't wait to come back and try their thai.  It looked amazing on the other tables and going into other people's mouths - yes, I was "that guy" last night staring at everyone and their food (I was starving!).

LFedg_wkD4FIwyss-PuUlw.text: This is my favorite restaurants! The staff is always so sweet and kind. They are very busy, but I do not mind the wait. I love the vegetarian pho and the yellow curry! It is priced just right. I normally get the medium pho and I end up having left overs. I would highly recommend this place if you love authentic pho :)

eRimu_RjRnAXMtEibqKiWg.text: Finally tried Viet-Thai while feeling the onset of my allergies flaring up. The ginger tea with honey and the Pho Ga was great! Served good and hot, great flavor and the right amount of spice! Servers where attentive and consistent, I'll be back!

_A30dZ08rBNXmchYEEKI8w.text: One of my friends raves about this place but I have to disagree.  On my first visit, I went for Chicken Pho.  And that's all it was, noodle soup with Chicken.  They were out of basil so you could not add that.  There were no vegetables included in the soup (The other vietnamese place I go to has broccoli, carrots, onions and mushrooms in their soup). Also the chicken was over cooked and tough.  My friend said their Thai was better than the Vietnamese so I gave them another try and ordered a Thai dish for lunch at $8.25.  The dish came out and I was disappointed with the size of the meal.  There were 4 pieces of chicken and again it was overcooked.  The rest of it was ok but I've had better Thai at a place down the street.    I really think this place is expensive for the quantity and quality of the food.

ZdkF05LR0kG_wcPMkrMxrQ.text: Visiting from out of town.  Read the reviews, went with Chicken Pad Thai. If this is the best in Charlotte, then you guys don't know Thai.  Bland, dry chicken, sorry Charlotte!

2l20lMN9fYEBrRnRP_SE4A.text: Favorite Thai food in Charlotte! Definitely 5 stars. I drive here from like 20 minutes away and it's always worth it.

W3-56dUJ_qNca4sPOEEvQw.text: Service was quick, efficient and friendly.  Food was savory, solid portions, and well prepared.  It's a clean, simple Chinese/Thai/Vietnamese mixed menu.  Tonight was cold night so I went with Pho and Summer Roll, both were tasty.  In/out the door for dinner under $17... No complaints on the pocket book either.  Next time I'm in town will try the Thai options...

tPjVUvIFzRiU1nGmwDAEgQ.text: What a delicious Thai house! It's been a few months since my husband and I were in the neighborhood. We heard great things about it and I would have to agree, it's a good place. It was a bit tricky to find...it's on the backside of a strip mall.  They give you menus with a wooden cover...nice touch. The server was efficient and attentive. We went on an off-time, but the food was still freshly made and flavorful.   I ordered a seafood noodle dish (can't remember the name and I branched out) and it was yummy! Hubs stuck with the staple veggie pad thai.   I had a great first time and look forward to coming back for another go!

LtluAOkH95QgDfvQR9s4Hw.text: This is my go-to Thai place. I'm never disappointed with the food. I think their Tom Kha soup is delicious. It got a good kick to it and is full of creamy coconut flavor, chicken, and mushrooms. I think their spring rolls are excellent, too. I usually order Pad Thai or yellow curry, which are both prepared perfectly. I have also had their pho and really enjoyed it. Go hungry because servings are usually really big.

EoCazgorL8uQk9j7SQkY8g.text: Last Saturday Night (skipping Charlotte Restaurant Week on Saturday) I had one of the best Thai meals I have eaten anywhere!!!  Viet Thai's version of Pad Thai is my Favorite!  This time I ordered it with Shrimp, Chicken and Pork.  Then I had: Nam Tok "Waterfall Beef Salad" Grilled Steak, Hot Chilli's, Cool Mint, Cucumbers, Cilantro, Red Onions - NO lettuce (YAY!!!) That is my kind of Salad (Makes the Zalad list for sure)!!!  If you have never had Waterfall beef salad you may want to share it with several people, it is very different and a lot of one taste, though the taste could be quickly acquired it may take more than one meal!  For Dessert I had Vietnamese Iced Coffee (sweetened with Sweetened Condensed Milk) - Fantastic!  As always the service was perfect!

LmMCnxcuzNfYwZZ9kbfotQ.text: Best Thai/Vietnamese restaurant in Charlotte from a former Thai restaurant owner. Everything is great there!  Love the Lad nah with seafood but EVERYTHING is delicious!  I got laughed at for ordering 3 entrees.  I just couldn't decide! Haaha!

zlemSa_nMhihZz4cJfatlw.text: I was excited to find a Pho restaurant in the area and went there for lunch. Unfortunately the broth was bland and the meat was very chewy.

ol4KBhN7R1zNymESpfQWUA.text: 1.Food - average food. Most of the dishes were oily but tasted good. Has a vast menu to choose from. Starters were ok, entrees were good. 2. Ambience - clean place, a bit dark 3. Service - good 4. Cost - Moderately priced.  Overall ok experience. Will not visit again.

s7JU-nYlt9G3WVNGh4WyZw.text: We came here with high expectations because of all the good reviews on Yelp.  But to my (our) dismay, the food here was GOD AWFUL!  We ordered spring and summer rolls.  The spring rolls were a little too crisp.  The summer rolls were filled with lettuce and noodles - no flavor.  We also ordered a Pho, house vermicelli, and the nam tok.  It was pretty sad.  I'm really upset so much food went to waste.  The Pho soup was bland and flavorless.  Their rare beef steak on the pho was of extremely poor quality.  The house vermicelli and the meats were of poor quality, Be Noodles had better meat than them, and we don't even like Be Noodles.  Their nam tok, was terrible - cooked beef with TERRIBLE flavoring.  To be honest, as people who eat Viet food all our lives and can make all these things, it was a real disappointment.  I'm not sure why people here keep giving it such high ratings.

udl_9e_P_33rTXKlCtxqtw.text: After trying this place twice in two weeks, this review would be a 5 star review.    Pho is excellent and my pad kee Mao is definitely the best I've had in Charlotte. The past 2x we've been there it has won me over and we knew we'd be repeat customers.  But, we went around 8:30 PM last night (Saturday night) and when we walked in we were stopped at the door and told that they had "run out of food" due to the fact they were so busy. I honestly thought that was some kind of joke. But as he explained they were "really busy" and we turned around and walked away, the guy didn't stop us to tell us he was messing with us.  How does this happen?  Really bad for business. The food is so good though, that I guess it still deserves 3 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pad Kee Mao with Chicken

HcKHTlX7EI0vvwjldBPjow.text: Best Thai food I've had in Charlotte yet. Everything I had was amazing , the service was great. Very cute clean restaurant. Going to be back soon.

kH-lel7dyDfx26s8GJ3vHQ.text: I've never had Vietnamese food before and really wanted to try the pho. We got goong hom saba for an app and it was fabulous!  Then I got the pho with shrimp, crab, and fish balls. This was something very different from what I would normally order, but it was absolutely delicious! My husband got the Bun (#28) and loved it.  The service was great. I can't wait to go back.

Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States

-HpGOsPlpv0XDN4EpyhUWw.text: Friendly staff and clean restaurant. The pho is very good and has lots of flavor. The shrimp fried rice actually had a good deal of shrimp in it and was tasty. Very reasonably priced.

ReZv9VwFMtxcpd3hklLAig.text: I've been going here for years.  I love this place!  The staff is friendly and the food is always fresh and tasty!

MQzN4JIzuY2aJoJ1TXECgQ.text: Pho has a light pleasant taste. Papaya salad is yum and perfectly sour/salty/spicy and not too stinky. BBH is different, but still tasty.  Prices are stupid high for no justifiable reason. To milk money from people who don't know about the other pho and Thai restaurants around that are better and more reasonable? Probably.   Order everything you want the first time because if you decide you want to order something else, say, to-go, you might be told they are too busy to make it for you.

5VJc5FS71fiaF8ox4f8YWQ.text: I often come here just for their coconut bubble tea! I had this one dish with noodles but I just can't recall the name anymore, it was delicious though. The noodles had a good spicy kick to them and the meat was nice and tender. It is a little hidden though.

jryFQutbncQ2rg3kiTPPNg.text: Get the beef larb and papaya salad here! They SURE knows how to make it the way we liked it!   The beef larb were real small beef pieces which is how I like my larb to be, I hated the ground minced taste.  They put soooo much fresh herbs in it which makes it soooo tasty!!! Super spicy and just beyond delicious.   As for the papaya salad, gosh, if I could lick and drink up the sauce I would definitely done it already. It was soo spicy and so good. I love that they put small (grilled!) shrimps in addition to it.  They're located behind a shopping strip mall area which I thought was a weird location b/c it's hidden and backward but it's nearby Burlington Coat Factory.  The inside is kind of dark and dingy but it was owned by a previous owner who didn't really make much changes to it when they brought the place.

p9qBjGAnLS6wmRJgDedVAg.text: This place is probably a 4-star for Charlotte, given the competition or lack thereof.   Everything was decent. The service and the cleanliness were all good. Service was also very prompt. These guys hustle. :)  The food was probably good for Charlotte, but to be honest, would be sub-par for anywhere else. I have to clarify that I'm a major food snob when it comes to a number of cuisines, Vietnamese being one of them.   The "summer rolls" were stuffed with the usual, but also had salad mix lettuce in it to beef it up. It's just not what I've ever seen. Two rolls were $5 and I find that pricey, but I can accept it. The shrimp in the rolls was fresh and the peanut sauce seemed fresh and homemade.  The pho was lacking. For one thing, a medium (which is the smallest they have) is $10. I don't think I've ever paid $10 for a bowl of pho. I'm used to prices in bigger cities, like, $5.50.  There didn't seem to be a load of meat, or anything terrible interesting in my companion's bowl. I didn't see what warranted the $10 price tag. My vegetarian bowl had a few thin strips of bell pepper, one mushroom, 4 small broccoli florets, and a couple triangles of fried tofu. It was okay. It was unfortunately very very salty and left my tongue tingling for several hours afterwards.  It gets the job done if you're really craving some pho, but I'm not sure I'd be clamoring to come here again. $35 for 2 people for a pho lunch is just insane.

jc68__XbkCpuu63FwbiDbQ.text: We've been here numerous times and the service and food has always been top notch...knock on wood!  We always order from the Thai menu. The best is the fried rice and the curries...yumm!! If you like spicy food, the green one is the spiced of them all!

nQWey7lhqfLm3MMqk6wfBg.text: Looove this place. Staff is friendly with on point service. We went kinda late and we did not feel rushed. Our food was great. The pho here is never a fail. The bowl is small but looks can be deceiving.

SUmqoVSVvlmBgP2iJaQXHA.text: Round two was equally as badass. Thai tea and bubble tea this time and both were awesome! Once again the staff were on point and very friendly. My pho was once again the pho to end all pho's and my soul destroyingly attractive girlfriend's pad thai was amazing! Fly to Viet-Thai you fools, fly!

_k_XnOb-zWK7virjmwTanA.text: yummy yummy pho!  Got the meatball pho and the wrapped shrimp appetizer, oh and some thai iced teas. All were exceptionally good! The shrimp one was a little hard to eat but super tasty.  The only complaint i had was i specifically picked this place cuz i thought they'd have the mango sticky rice cuz someone put a picture of it on here. Sadly there was no mango sticky rice to be found :(

azMKTE-RdXlP3K6HfIgeTg.text: Great food, quick service, however, unless you like really really spicy food, what they call medium is what I would call hot. And I'm a fan of spicy food too. They always ask if you want it medium, tell them you want it mild!!!! Do yourself a favor, order it mild and add Siracha if you need it, chances are, you won't!

V1k9k_-gKyuR67gIsx0eug.text: I walked in and the place smelled amazing so I knew that was a good sign!  Got the summer shrimp rolls to start and they were great, very fresh and the peanut sauce was awesome.   I had the chicken pho-medium size-which is more than enough for 1 person.  Great experience and I loved the atmosphere!

SJjCASBPA2rcfecPW_2cMQ.text: We have dined at this restaurant several times for lunch. The staff is very friendly and the food has great flavor and is always seasoned according to your taste!  Today I had the rice bowl with steak and shrimp. The steak was a little tough, however, the shrimp, rice noodles and vegetables were phenomenal!  We have also tried the pho here and it is amazing!  Will definitely return to this restaurant and recommended for anyone who would like to try the Vietnamese cuisine.

UoaeFrcZOKHINXgLRXgjhg.text: Previously, I'd only had Thai here (primarily Pad Thai and Tom Yum soup), but recently had the Pho Ga (chicken) and the Mi Xa Xiu Tom (chicken & pork) and both were outstanding.  I'd recommend requesting some chili oil to add if you're like me and provide your Thai / Vietnamese on the spicy side.  All in all, quite good!

sg4WP6rM6LQjsGx9vlgM8Q.text: Best pho in town. I have been here many times and I'm never disappointed. Summer rolls are amazing as well!

9nf-k3vmivQHAlL-0ECfLQ.text: I love Thai food and was looking to add another Thai place to my fav list here in Charlotte.  I stopped here and got two dinners to go.  What a huge disappointment.  The chicken dish I got for my father.. we had to search for quite some time before we were able to find even a small piece of chicken.  And my dish tasted so bad (low quality) that after a few bites I had to throw it out.. and I hate wasting food.  If I tried the place again, it may get better stars, but unfortunately this experience was so bad, I can't pull myself to give it another try.  Sorry to give a bad review, but it was what it was.

bJoGXR4JEBKDYDOjxzcQ-Q.text: This place was amazing,  a little hard to find because it was hidden but the food is amazing and really authentic.  The service was good too, all the employees were  really nice !

oHky5wqIWC0sHaEVQTqvDA.text: Visited just tonight based off the rating. Definitely delivered. I had one of the vermicelli salads and my fiance had the pineapple fried rice. Both were full of flavor and came in a pretty decent sized portion. The rest of the menu looked interesting also and I look forward to going back.

B8OigiOWqtJYT3PvJmnBkg.text: We went with a big group so we go to try lots of plates, the service was great and food was super tasty, pad tai highly recommended !!!! Pineapple fried rice delish, the shrimp appetizer was crazy good, so where the spring rolls and summer rolls!! Will definitely be back!!!

BmDxtrDLc49oS-uoBBz3qA.text: I've had Vietnamese and Thai food just about all over the country and who woulda thunk it that Charlotte would be home to the best I've ever had? Bottom line: it is. BIG portions, great price, AWESOME taste. If you're ever passing by or close, make it there.

y8SB829CN6-Xg5-AejUexg.text: The food is top notch.  I'll keep coming back for the pho and the vermicelli.  The service, as it appears to be with most un-americanized Asian establishments, is lacking severely.  We ordered a few things to split, amongst them the pho, asked for a split of that item into 2 bowls, seemed like an impossibility.  They just insisted they would help split the damn thing at the table with chopsticks and a small serving spoon.  Split it in the effin kitchen! It defies logic to try to do something so messy out at the table.  We did say to hell with it and just ordered a second one.  (They win?) I tip well here, i don't think i'm going to anymore, they don't care if i do, and they don't accommodate me, or remember me, ever, so you know...but all aside the food is killer.

hFpbM7CqjuhCF1Bkvo6EPQ.text: My wife and I were looking for something new and found this place via yelp. It doesn't look like much from the outside and it's hard to find. But we weren't disappointed. It's my first time to try Vietnamese food. It was delicious. We had summer rolls for an app, very good. I had a pork and rice dish, my wife a chicken and noodles. The staff was courteous, food quick and tasty, a nice relaxing atmosphere.

Dh03i2G5lxmfrVaM5tt1lA.text: Best thai ever trust me so so good the food is amazing.  They have so many menu choices that all sound delicious that I was tempted to get two dishes that night, especially since I was starving.  Spicy don't ask for mild it would not be mild it will be very spicy. This was great authentic Thai food, yes, I did get the Pad Thai. Service is quick and efficient for a place that's popular.

qPOHbMsPjXF3DgWf-XeSyg.text: If its pho you want it's pho you get.   I haven't made it past that but I'm very happy with the product.  Nice to have it on this side of town as well.

ciYbUsxO5Ej0IIYgz6C_AQ.text: The food is excellent and fresh. The service is super friendly and prompt. Try the fresh spring roll. This restaurant has quickly become a favorite.

tVE6HGB_Cn6BnyYo0P5Rzw.text: This restaurant is great for satisfying appetites of a group! Because they offer both Vietnamese and Thai cuisine, there is a large menu with lots of delicious options.   The restaurant is comfortable, features a full bar and TVs, and has a few fun fish tanks. The service has always been prompt and friendly, and the food has always come out very quickly. Portions are a good size- I always had leftovers.   They also have bubble tea- I haven't found it other places in Charlotte. They have about 20 different flavors- I only tried Black Milk tea, but it was comparable to the Bubble Tea I've had in NYC.   Overall, I would recommend!

QYNvaNReocnsZZWZr35iEA.text: Fail again. Meat in our food when we ordered all tofu. When asked for a refund, I was told by Toni that they would comply. Next day when I called to make sure the refund was processed, she stated she gave my husband eight dollars cash to refund our bad food. Our meal was $36.00. This, of course, never occurred.  Please do not do what we did and ask for compensation for a bad meal..you will be lied to and spend 5 minutes arguing with someone who has the nerve to call herself a manager.  We will NEVER visit again - last straw. Can you curse on Yelp?  No?  Screw these liars.

_ed2GL4HABznKHfTV49eWA.text: My husband and I frequently visit this restaurant when we go to Charlotte.  We always went there for their Vietnamese and it is amazing!  When we went there yesterday, we decided to try their Thai food and it was the best Thai we have had in either Carolina.  It was so good that we ordered take-out and had it for both lunch and dinner today (food portions are huge!).

2igH_1ZXplBwsHZkdPhA1w.text: I enjoyed my lunch experience. I tried a thai noodle dish similar to pad thai except the noodles are wider. I really liked the sauce in the dish. It was listed as being a spicy dish. Most traditional Thai food when listed as spicy is hot. This dish wasn't. The prices are average . My husband ordered pho which had a good flavor but the accompanying basil, bean sprouts could have been better. Overall the experience is nice and I particularly enjoy Thai dishes while he enjoys Pho so it was nice that we could dine in one place and both order our preferences.

DStKLXsE4jME9xXDYx84bw.text: Pretty good. Nothing great to blow me away though. The pho broth was just right. Other places seem to throw their broth together in the morning but you can tell this was cooked the correct way...simmering over night. The beef was tender and the beef balls didn't have that taste as if they were frozen. Really the only downside was the basil, it wasn't fresh. Had a grass taste to it and no hints of cinnamon. With all that said though, this is the only place I've been to that has an XL portion.

aSDKupZl5iOTuGgcpZPRAA.text: Inexpensive, tasty, excellent potions sizes.  Quiet, yet busy.

utUbwtUbJJkW5RjpRgGYIQ.text: hubs got 5 star hot curry and it was really great. I got their pad thai, but really wished I would have went with my original order ( I changed my mind as soon as I ordered). I really wanted the grilled chicken with the vermicelli noodles, but hey  I will go back and get that next time. my 11 yr old got the grilled chicken rice dish and the chicken was spiced perfectly. Their fish sauce was delish. Plan on going back. Oh, btw they have bubble tea. we got coconut and it was very tasty. the little bubbles weren't as big as other places, that is a plus. prices were good, but as usual if you go anywhere on a sunday, you are not going to get the great lunch prices.

n2ORiqqU7SciZalnGea06g.text: For a medium sized city such as Charlotte, this is a pretty darn good Vitenamese/Thai/Lao restaraunt!!! This is one of those places that you find on accident, but the food will keep you coming back! The people are nice (most of the time), the menu is to-the-point (good variety but not overwhelming) and the price is very generous. For those customers that are not familiar with southeast asian cuisine, it may be hard to figure out the dishes, since their descriptions are very similar. I'm usually not a fan of restaraunt made Pad-thai noodles, but I have to say, this places serves one of the best Pad-thai's I've ever eaten here in the States.

Y274zAAnzdx6EXJQcw8gYQ.text: Really good Pad Thai. My favorite in Charlotte. Just doesn't seem very clean there. It doesn't help they have a huge fish tank that looks like it hasn't been cleaned for a very long time. If you like hole in the walls, this is a good place.

WCVvKfufo4lP-f1d7O5rEg.text: The food was excellent, and normally might rate a 5, but I am a big Thai food fan.  I have been to Thai restaurants all over the world, including a few Zagat highly-rated restaurants in Thailand and one in Makati, Philippines.  So, I tend to be very precise in my evaluation of Thai food.  I had Chicken Satay, Tom Kha Gai, and Panaeng Gai with white rice at this restaurant.  I had the Ginger Tea to drink.      The Chicken Satay was nicely cooked and somewhat juicy.  It was not overcooked as some Chicken Satays that I have had.    The peanut sauce was tasty, but a little weak -- I have had peanut sauces that had a stronger peanut flavor and a thicker consistency. One of the best Chicken Satays I have had was an appetizer on a business class flight with Malaysia Airlines.  It was thick and very "peanut-y".  This peanut sauce was not so thick and had less peanut flavor.      The Tom Kha Gai was nicely seasoned with just a little "kick".  The trick with Tom Kha Gai is the balance between coconut milk and the broth.  Too much coconut milk makes the broth too thick and sweet, but this Tom Kha Gai leaned more with too much broth and not enough coconut milk.  It was just slightly off, and, for me, rated a little below the best that I have had.        The Panaeng Gai (sweet, mild red curry chicken) was spot on.  I asked for the spice heat level to be closer to medium (not mild), and the chef hit the target perfectly.    The sauce and chicken blended excellently with the slightly sticky rice.  The red curry sauce had excellent flavor.  I actually wanted more sauce to blend in with the rice.  The portion size was perfect.  I walked out very full, but that was only because I had both soup and appetizer.  If I had passed on one of the two prelim items, I would have had room for dessert.        Finally, the ginger tea was very well brewed.  It was brewed long enough to have excellent flavor.  Often, I have found that restaurants over-sweeten it with too much honey, or they rush it and don't steep it long enough.  This restaurant hit the target excellently.  I wanted to stay longer after my meal just to continue to sip the quality flavor of the ginger tea.        Overall, this restaurant provided excellent Thai food.  I would have rated it higher, but I have been spoiled by sampling some of the best Thai food in the world.  Yet, the next time I am in Charlotte and in the mood for Thai food, I may make a return visit.

6Ays8whkn_9sAdO2JJtUCQ.text: When ever we want Thai food, this is the only place for us . Friendly staff and great tasting food.

vyaDkYMw5ZrdFx1EP6x2oQ.text: Once again, the fresh summer rolls and chicken pad thai  were fantastic. Best I've ever had. The staff if friendly and attentive.  Love this place!

QOaPoZ_TO8qXv9wiimU5hg.text: Very happy to have found great Thai Food in Charlotte as I had tried a few places before finding Viet-Thai.  The spice levels are from 1-5 but I will tell you, its definitely spicy at a 2, and has me sweating at a 3.  That said, I cant get enough of it.  The Pad Kee Mao(drunken noodles) that they have here are amazing.  I go about two times a month or so and always take those traveling in to Charlotte for work here if they are in the mood for Thai.  Its the closest I have found to Thai food up north, and the only thing I wish that they had that they dont, is the ability to take American Express.

iqEDft7AU1eU6D25FjaxMg.text: If you're willing to dig for this place, considering it's tucked away in some undiscovered cove at the Lowe's shopping center off of Highway 51, then you won't be disappointed. It's a small place, maybe 15 tables tops, but the variety of Vietnamese and Thai dishes will leave you thirsting for more. I love the Pho Ga, and it's always good that the chef will tailor the spicy taste to your preference.   Friendly staff, and you'll get your order served to you pretty quickly. Since I've been craving noodles and Pho like some addict lately, Viet-Thai Noodle House has been the perfect place to satisfy my jones.

qWttWBwCGJWwBFHRUz5nlQ.text: Best Thai food I've ever had. Period. The server was very rude, but the food is great! I've eaten inside twice and gotten the same server both times, she's too rude for me to tolerate any more(she is the only reason I didn't rate 5 stars) I've been ordering take out since, and the gentleman on the phone and in person is always pleasant and professional. All in all I'd recommend just ordering to go bc the service isn't worth the tip but the food is exemplary!

JH9UNI3RYamx4m52JoVkLQ.text: Oh my gosh! This place is sooooo dingy in the inside! looks like they never clean this place up, plus the waitstaff was horrible, I didn't know if they worked there or were customers since they didn't have a uniform..had to wait about 15 minutes for someone to come take our order..The food was okay but apparently a lot of people like it cuz the place was full..I wouldn't go back just because of the atmosphere. .

bk9hVFv60E3iLpEE6RWh3w.text: On the plus side it was a nice environment with soft but not too dark lighting. Quick and pleasant service and nice choice of both Vietnamese and Thai dishes. However I found some of the meat gristly and tofu on the soft side. In summary, okay but not one I'd rush back to again.

z7g8EB0goTAoSWuHVdeE2Q.text: This was my second time here. The pad Thai is excellent and I recommend getting the Mung Bean noodles.   It was my first time having Pho so I have nothing to compare it to but it was delicious.   The portions for the Pho are huge. We got the medium and it was served in a inflatable kidding pool.   On their spicy scale, I ordered my pad Thai at a level 3. It was spicy with great flavor. My nose is running as I type this but I can still feel mouth.   We are lunch at 11:30 on a Saturday so it wasn't crowded. I don't know how the service is during busy times but our waiter was probably one of the friendliest and most polite waiters we've had.   The hostess to other servers were asking if we needed anything and were always within reach.   I have found my Thai go-to in Charlotte.

ZnVwfRp6yp20OAxlF4qiUA.text: This place reminds me of the little hole-in-the-wall restaurants in Chinatown, but bigger, and in strip mall setting.  Not much to say about the decor, (ie. Kitchy wood carved menu covers, vinyl covered booths)  but the food is really fresh tasting, and overall pretty solid.    The The Tom Kha Gai soup was good...but very salty.  My husband loved it.  This version has a distinct coconut flavor and you can see and taste the fresh herbs and lemongrass and kaffir lime leaves.    My main dish was the vermicelli noodle bowl with seasoned strips of beef, cilantro, shredded cucumber, lettuce, grilled onions and lots of peanuts.  The dish came with a sweet dipping sauce and an eggroll on top.  Love that there was a generous mini-soup bowl sized amount of this sweet sauce. This dish was simple, delicious and didn't make me feel like a bloaton afterward.  (That's a bloated Megatron.)   TIP: This restaurant serves bubble tea $3.50.  The soft drinks and iced teas are $2 each.   The service was a bit slow, especially since there were only a handful of tables, but that was made up for in attentive drink refilling and friendly servers who took their time to chat with guests.    Ultimately, I'd definitely go back and try other items.  More authentic than, say Basil, but not as polished.  But if you want a good, fresh meal, served to you in an inviting, casual setting, go for Viet Thai!   PS.  Once the weather cools down, I'm trying the pho.  Lots of Asians were eating it at Viet Thai. That's one thing I miss about living in Chinatown, is the super cheap steaming bowls of noodles!

8TiyF19UAFxdej1_izgRvg.text: I love the noodles.  They don't bother me when I'm reading.  The portions are super big.  The only down side is the beef is sometimes dry.  Pretty neat fish tank too.

kgv-y0s_qYzPy20LS43c-w.text: To be fair they made everything right. And promise it was an error that won't happen again. The place is legit so with my one complaint resolved fear not. You will love this place.

6K9KM_yxIDzdBh4xoX7Q3Q.text: Was really excited to try from the reviews, but the service was terrible and the food was only ok. We went for 20 minute periods with no water, it was unclear who was responsible for what, and you could not order a drink, get your bill, etc. without quite a bit of effort. The food wasn't bad, but the flavors weren't great, and it was slightly over- cooked. I would not go back.

WCMmJNiapEsGyLDtWh9vcw.text: Yeah, I bet all ya'll South Charlottans feel pretty cool, huh? Having the best Thai in Charlotte down there, floating around the perimeter like frickin' Pluto? 485, shmoreightyfive. I'm down to drive the CrapRV out here for a meal like I had the other night any night of the week. Except for Monday. On which they are closed.  First signs of kickassness: bitter melon chunks, skewered and grilled, on the veg satay app. So maybe Julia Child knew how awesome hot Cukes can be (see: braised cucumbers, Mastering the Art of French Cooking, 1961) but the fact has escaped our collective palates since. Here's the bitter melon, all funny looking, spiny, sea urchin cuke, dipped in a molassessy sauce, grilled to translucency, making my frickin' day.  Mushrooms were there too. Some tofu. Perfect.  Then out comes the curry (they made it tongue-searingly hot, as requested) - and the best fried rice (full of veggies, more melon, smoky, salty, sweet, nutty) - and these noodles (if all Pad Thai tasted this awesome, Thai food snobs would quit snubbing the stuff) - and everyone's just smiling, stuffing their faces, kind of surprised, shoving it in like the oasis of really, really good food is about to vanish. Sorry, Monsoon, but you've been supplanted. Viet-Thai, I love you.

IAjI97Wz6oc7nIttpSL1Pg.text: I am here once a week for the pho and pad thai. Awesome! Spring rolls, summer rolls and fried rice are also terrific. Lee, Toni, Paul, Kevin and Tumi are also friendly and accommodating.

62dz590S4fG8gqMCulQC_Q.text: I've finally found my favorite Thai/Vietnamese in Charlotte!  I've enjoyed everything I've ordered from here, particularly the pho.

92UE_iKuWR3XBkFS8eTjeA.text: I drove around the parking lot looking for this place, and thought maybe I was at the wrong shopping center...luckily I found it on the back side.  I'm really glad I didn't give up.  I went in for a late lunch, and it was empty, but I was greeted by the friendly proprietor and seated quickly.  I've never had Vietnamese cuisine before, so with some help from my server, I ordered the large beef combination pho and some spring rolls to start.  The spring rolls were excellent, but once I saw the bowl of noodles, I realized I probably should have skipped them.  The broth was delicious, especially after a little siracha, with plenty of noodles and beef.  I would probably skip the tripe and meatballs next time, but everything else was great.  I was full about half way through, but it tasted so good I had to finish the bowl.  Probably more like 4 1/2 stars, but that's not an option.  I'll definitely be back.

tFkWEgIo2G45x-fhE70J5w.text: Let's just say my friends and I come here once a week, if not more. They are a hidden gem with authentic Thai and Vietnamese food. The staff is used to seeing me and they are friendly and sociable with everyone. Everything on the menu is delicious. Honestly the only thing I won't eat is the tripe and tendon in the pho. I always get house special com dia, a rice dish. I also enjoy the bun, which is a rice noodle salad. The pad see ew is scrumptious! All of their Thai dishes are good and perfectly spiced. They have excellent broth for the pho. I love it! They also have yummy fresh squeezed orange juice and bubble tea! You have to try it!

xcyIc7Wfe2mubWujDHgmAQ.text: Anytime I see "noodle house" my mouth starts to water.  I have seen this restaurant a while back but haven't had a chance to go.  This past Sunday I was in the mood for some vietnamese noodle soup and decided that I wanted to try somewhere different than the normal vietnamese restaurants that I go to in town.  Like most Vietnamese/Thai restaurants, this place is located in the most unassuming location.  As soon as I opened the door, I can smell all the wonderful aromatics that come from an authentic Viet or Thai kitchen.  It's indescribable.  The place was pretty large but not many tables.  I assume that it's family owned since the family was having lunch at one of the back booths.  I ordered the goi cuon (vietnamese spring rolls) and bun bo hue noodle soup.  The goi cuon tasted like home made vietnamese spring rolls that my mom makes during the holidays.  Be careful eating them though because those suckers were very hot, but yummy!    Bun bo hue for those of you who have not had the pleasure of tasting is primarily beef and lemon grass based soup although it normally also has pork or pig feet in it.   If you are new to the noodle soup scene and have only tried pho and love it, well then you would love bun bo hue.  Just try it next time you hit up a Vietnamese restaurant.  Back to my soup.  It's served with large rice noodles and an assortment of fresh veggies (bean sprouts, sliced banana leaves, purple cabbage, lime, cilantro and shrimp paste).  It was so flavorful and delicous.  I ate everything and drank all the soup.  No complaints what so ever.  My boyfriend got the beef pad thai.  Not the best I've ever had.  Would say it's a 6.5 out of 10.  The cook must have had a heavy hand when adding the fish sauce that particular day.    Overall it was a really good restaurant.  I've even invited friends to join me for lunch there this weekend.  Can't wait to try the other dishes.  PS - The menu was pretty diverse with authentic Thai food from curries to laarb to paad kee mao, etc.  Vietnamese food included pork chop rice plates, bun, and pho.  It also had a vegetarian section.  Went back today for lunch with friends and also had their roasted pork fried rice.  Delicious!

uAIVBnZCngftG5eRPScKPQ.text: The food was great, very authentic. Some of our party got Vietnamese and some got Thai and everyone was pleased. The location is cozy, good service, good food. No complaints. We got lunch size portions and it was plenty for the men and I had leftovers. Would return.

6GkYEtyxBDaYfBLgjFOokQ.text: Unlike Thai-Viet in Indian Trail, I love this place! The curries are good, the pho is great, and the pad thai is good as well. The staff has always been friendly and the restaurant has plenty of room to feel somewhat private as you eat. The decorations are nice and you can feel comfortable (not crowded). Try the tea/bubble tea.

nPLbaf8TBA2ig7ig6tYeDw.text: As an avid lover of pho, I took the family out to this place the other night as it is the only place in Pineville -- that I could find -- that sells it. Luckily for me, it is EXCELLENT.   Their pho broth is perfect! Full of flavor and aromatic. We also had their red curry chicken and chicken pad-thai, which were also very good.   Food is fresh, service is great, the restaurant is clean and well decorate, prices are reasonable. Definitely a great place to hit if you are in the Pineville area and have a hankering for pho, vietnamense or thai food.

6Xevjr_t2xU7-qt5NcYufg.text: Did not order here. My cousin came here once and ordered pad thai and said it was super slow. Then we returned and we both ordered a regular milk tea bubble tea. which was $4 per bubble tea, hefty but not atypical in the Charlotte area. The bubble tea was alright, not bad, it was a smoothie not a tea. Size wise it was big, and flavors were nice. However it was nothing outstanding. The reason why this place idid not get 4 stars from me is that even just making the bubble teas, they took FOREVER.

cSp72T0jUC8JU2YPbfiULA.text: Amazing service & even better food!!! I am in love with their pho bowls!!! Perfection!! I will be returning again!

uqFaC5YPHwTWyKszDHiTWQ.text: I love this place!!! Everything I have ever gotten is delicious and makes me happy!! Perfect noodles, perfect pho.  Thai food is flavorful and tasty! Service is great!!  I will definitely keep coming back. Yum!!!!!

dsW-QJTYcwdIJCexGk_n7w.text: Came here for lunch with my colleagues when I was visiting Charlotte for work.   First of all, the lunch portions are HUGE.  I ordered a tofu satay which is actually an appetizer and I thought it wouldn't be enough.... But it was actually 4 sticks with marinated and grilled eggplant, mushroom, red pepper, tofu and squash or zucchini (still don't know the difference ... Sorry) this came with side of peanut sauce... Absolutely loved it.  My colleagues ordered the veg pho, the egg noodles and a Vietnamese beef item and everyone thoroughly enjoyed !!  A very elaborate menu I have seen in a long time... Will definitely come back to try out other things !

DkYiFyeNhAugQxbM5dh1mA.text: The Pho is great with fresh basil, bean sprouts, and jalapeno to go in it. I order their spring rolls and sauce it makes the right combination for your tastebuds to explode in your mouth.  If you have never been here a must try!

8tpgnnfHffZ2qDj6aW0sBA.text: I really enjoyed this place tonight and the service was great! We had a guy service is and he explained everything in full detail. I had Beef Pho which was piping hot just like I love it with all my addins. Very clean and quite although my sister, cousin and I were laughing loud. The other guest didn't seem to mind they just laughed with us. That's just how we are. Really great spot and prices are excellent!

p9EwdUZmGZBJ6ioA7QQNJA.text: Staff was very friendly and attentive. Very clean atmosphere with nice decor. Lighting seems to be just right. The food was wonderful. Spring rolls were probably the best I ever had... Green Curry was awesome but medium was still a little hot for me. Next time I will order mild.  Our lives are so busy and chaotic, I notice little things like the background music and a calming atmosphere. This place has both. I almost don't want to leave. Lol. Maybe, I will just stay until dinner is served. Big Tip: It is a little hard to find... But so worth it! It's in a very small strip mall on the back side or behind Burlington Coat Factory... which is also in a strip mall. Just keep driving around. You will get there.

bnLRKLVoZFYF145l6jjB2g.text: This place is so awesome!!!! Service is always nice and management is so friendly! Food is large portions and very fresh. I've had their pad kee Mao and it's so good and spicy!! I always get the pho with shrimp and crab. Broth is so savory. Love the green onions and fresh cilantro with it. Sliced jalapenos give it a kick. Shrimp is large and they give you a lot of crab. Chili oil is the spiciest I've ever had! So make sure you do a few drops and then test it out lol. Clean restaurant and fresh food. Love this place.

-5XL_OVHqJF4Oiik0UhdUw.text: the Pho is fabulous here. We like the fried spring rolls as well. Decent prices and can choose from several sizes. Pleasant atomosphere and staff is friendly and quick. great place to stop for lunch.

73CqvLJWLb1HHQb0rmY2rQ.text: The food is excellent. Pho#45 is my favorite. I can eat that once a week.  I've tried other Noodle houses, this one is the best by far

VqmDzu8YlM_jrK9bDJHmbA.text: Maybe my hopes were too high from all the awesome reviews? The fella and I ventured in on a brutally cold Wednesday night, which might explain why our waitress was wore her winter coat the entire time, but it seemed really odd. So did their 93 health score rating. But I digress!  The service was spot on - just the right amount of attention. I ordered the chicken pad thai because I'm just that boring, and it was... okay. It was a little more orange in color than I'm used to, and there wasn't a ton of flavor, but it was a huge portion! The fella got chicken and noodles with an egg roll, and he said it was pretty good.  Overall, Viet-Thai was solid, but nothing to write home about.

JeFN8G_DIWEpDignG_s4XA.text: This place is the most wonderful thing ever. I love the pho and the fish tank. It is one of the only places in the world that has both affordable and great authentic food. I also love the cute menus because there is a little wooden bowl of noodles that is sticking out from the menu. You guys saved my life after my horrible experience at Longhorn Steakhouse.

S4lx1rKOA9w1WycqoZ0czg.text: I don't think I've ever been disappointed by their service or food. As soon as you walk in you'll be greeted and seated. They will provide you their menu and give you enough time to scan the menu items. They serve both authentic Vietnamese and Thai cuisines. I love the pho especially, it brings me back to memories of home cooked meals and my daily adventures to Chinatown in Los Angeles. Unfortunately this place is kind of hard to find. It's behind the plaza where the Burlington coat factory is in Pineville, NC. Lately my boyfriend has been venturing out into Asian cuisine and he's never been big on Vietnamese food but when I took him here he became a huge fan! He kept saying that the food was excellent and we are already planning to come back.  The boba tea is also amazing! I couldn't find a place that serves Boba/ Bubble tea unless it was inside The Pineville Mall. Try the honey dew flavor boba tea, you will be happy to give it a try! Sometimes the best food comes from a hole in the wall. This place is a great example of that saying.

cvuHcnH3g6i_osBtt2-GuA.text: Holy heck--this place is amazing! I probably never would have gone here if a client hadn't suggested it for our lunch but it was GREAT!! They have Vietnamese and Thai food (hence the name). Both cuisines are absolutely phenomenal. Here is a run down of what I tried:  Summer rolls 5/5 Absolutely delicious, especially the peanut sauce! Chicken wings 5/5 Great flavor, fried perfectly Pho Bac Diet 5/5 AWESOME flavor Tea 5/5- Better than typical tea I would expect  Service excellent and inviting! I will make it back

YjsqIjwnU6eVs2ZfaFy2wA.text: Literally have been ordering the same meal for years..and have never been disappointed.  A lot of lunches with co-workers have been had here too. I can't recall anyone ever saying their food was not good. A definite must for Thai food.  Take note that they seem busier on rainy days.

dfc87DbuJ1HMlIMUEhYSyA.text: Loved the interior of this place. The pad thai was very good - really enjoyed the taste, especially the tofu!   The smell is evident when you walk in. It makes you even hungrier, not to mention being able to see everyone else's dishes!

photos.caption: Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States

zxeQ1S0ONumIDkrqk9eAsg.text: Looking for something to eat after shopping at Lowe's nearby. They call themselves Viet Thai noodle house, right? We figured the best way to test was to order the pho bo (viet beef noodles) and Pad Kee Mow (Thai stir fried rice noodles).  The food - $12 for a large pho is on the expensive side (usually $10 by CLT local standards), but the broth was a big fail. It tasted exactly like the packaged MSG pho soup base, with zero depth in taste that you would normally expect from beef bones, meat and oxtail. The pad Kee mow was also very different to the traditional Thai version we had at every other Thai place run by Thai people. No hint of fish sauce or the sweetness you would expect, but otherwise ingredients were acceptable.   My wife and I already decided we wouldn't return near the end of our meal. What drove the final nail in the coffin was, as I was signing the check, the server who came to clear our table stopped after picking up two plates, and asked if we can hand him the rest. Really?

axqzRdqOTbZKepJTzKI7gQ.text: While in town I was searching for something for dinner to go but was intrigued by the main photo for Viet-Thai Noodle House which is the mango sticky rice with ice cream, raisins, and peanuts.  It was a hot day so I was really looking forward ordering just this alone.  it came out to be $7 which was more than I expected but I figured I would just go with it especially if it included as much as in the photo.  I didn't have to wait really long even though there were many patrons there.  As the hostess gave me my order, I wanted to confirm if my order was the same as the photo posted on Yelp.  She said they don't carry ice cream anymore.  The dessert didn't have nuts or raisins.  I could have gotten the same dessert for $4.95/$5/95 at the Thai House with a saucer of coconut sauce.  Not sure if i'll return and I love green curry & pad prig.  It was good though but a ripped off.

_gyhGgjfhU9EEyXVi8aSrw.text: oh.Em.GEE!!!!  Viet-Thai is wonderful!!!  I have been searching for a really good place to get pad Thai for quite a while, and I've finally found it!  The pad Thai here is by far the most authentic-tasting pad Thai I have had yet in Charlotte!  I ordered mine with chicken and at spicy level 3 and it was absolutely perfect!  I went with my boyfriend for a late lunch one day and he ordered pho, which was also delicious ^_^  Our food came out SO quickly that I was amazed by that alone...  After our main dishes, I made sure I saved room for a Thai bubble tea and I'm so incredibly glad I did -- it was fantastic!  I will most definitely be a repeat customer here!

ADIehbJMUeq-Q-IdSLY0cw.text: I had come to this restaurant to try the Bun Dac Biet. I had never had Vermicelli of any kind before so I knew this experience was going to be a new one for me. As soon as the noodles entered my mouth, I was filled with awe. The Vietnamese got this one right. Combining salad with the rice noodle to create this mixture is what good food is all about. I definitely enjoyed my experience and plan to order this same meal on my next visit.

9cuxetd5FPFV086C6gj9ug.text: We had Dau Hu Xao (meal #69) and Pad Him Ma (meal #92) Plenty of food.  Great Flavor.  Excellent service with an endless menu. There is another location in Indian Trail that we plan to visit next.  We may just have to add "Viet-Thai Noodle House" to our list of places to visit again & again!! I strongly suggest you visit them!

_THmsc5mabusYmCtrO_qdw.text: Viet-Thai has been favorite bun (vermicilli dish) in Charlotte. We came on a Saturday night and the place was pretty steady - short waits for larger parties, but we were able to sit down pretty quickly. We started with the papaya salad. Spice levels go up to 5, and we ordered ours at level 2 and my mouth was on fire. The salad came with small grilled shrimps, which really added to the huge plate of dressed papaya strands. This would be a perfect dish to order during the summer.  I had the grilled shrimp bun. It was perfection. Good size bowl, great fish sauce, perfectly grilled shrimp, good amount of greens. I'm interested to try their grilled chicken bun next time. I've been turned off by the recent ones I've had around Charlotte - I don't like it when the grilled chicken is cooked too dry - but I'm curious to try Viet-Thai's version.   Our servers were super helpful and made sure our beverages were constantly filled. It was a great dining experience.

3P6l3tdZGVLbFgdBdnSDmw.text: Just called at 8:45 on a Saturday night. I noticed that they closed at 9:30 rather than 9 online, so I felt comfortable doing this.  I was told that actually the kitchen closed at 9:15 and they were not going to accept any more take out orders tonight because they still had a party of 20 to feed.   Are you kidding me????  I have been in food service for a long time and maybe I shouldn't review this while I am still ultimately enraged but do you know how many times I have not had my husband home until hours after his restaurant closed because someone came in 5 min til close? Or how many times when I was waiting tables that I had to stop and take call in orders in the middle of a rush? I have never ever heard of anything like that before and I am totally appalled at their customer service.   I told my poor tired chef husband I would pick him up anything he wanted for dinner since he has worked doubles plus plus every single day for weeks and is now heading right into Mother's Day weekend, aka the worst holiday ever for restaurants. He said pad thai sounded good and I was looking forward to trying this place after the great reviews on here.   Sorry you were too busy to throw out 2 more orders of Pad Thai and some summer rolls an hour before you closed. Hope it was worth losing 2 customers.

NyPPQUXhHbeVTqg-7c539A.text: 4 years later since I first dined here... now a lot more busier than back then, but food is just as good as it was the first time! By now, I've experimented with most items on the menu and they're always consistently made and you can expect the same when you order again.  Service is very friendly as well. Overall, a very good family establishment!

A1vbfBMEz9SemD7KLeHgfA.text: I enjoyed everything I had...from the Tom Kha Gai to the pad thai :) service was friendly even when I managed to pop in 30 mins before closing. There was even a couple who got there later than I did and they were treated well. Next time I will try the pho!

RhnbONGRcXWphV4SDeEpzg.text: I absolutely LOVE this place. It's truly authentic Thai and Vietnamese food. The summer fresh rolls are to die for. Highly recommend!

YQQy9IBS9F3Pwe0O3WVQow.text: If you part on the side of the complex near the Burlington Coat Factory, look for the sign that says "Noodle House" and you'll find it.  We ordered the chicken larb - which was pretty spot on and authentic.  My friend had the bun bo hue - not enough flavor in the soup, not terrible just not great. No pig feet but that's rare in Charlotte to have something *that* authentic.  I had the pork ka prow - the veggies were not Thai at all, just generic stir-fry mix and the flavors were muted. It could have used a lot more basil.  Overall, it was about $60 for 2 entrees and an appetizer which I think is a bit much for what should be cheap.

im35GuEEV3YQJRqFHG8wOA.text: Finally. Thai food in Charlotte that makes me smile and feel happy. Let's see: tastes authentic;  check. Not overpriced: check. Server is Thai: check. Yes.  I LIKE it!  Let me give you some perspective. I love Thai; have spent time in Thailand and I'm picky when it comes to Thai restaurants. Viet-Thai Noodle House isn't "THE" best Thai restaurant I've ever been to but it's top notch authentic Thai that brings a smile to my face and it's just as good as Bangkok.   I gave it five stars not because it's the best I've "ever" had (though it's definitely up there), but because it's far and away the best I've had in Charlotte.   I had the (something) Prix Khing Ped (chicken). It's grilled chicken with green beans and chopped sweet red and green pepper served in a red curry sauce with rice. I told my server that I liked my spice"Bangkok normal" and she suggested I don't add spice. It wasn't spicy at all when it came out but I wasn't upset at all. I'd rather have to add chili than not be able to eat a dish and that's just what I did. I learned the hard way that mild at one place can be "native" at another so I always err on too mild my first time to a place I haven't been to before.  Next time I'll try three stars of heat and adjust from there. Once I got the heat where I like it, it was just as good as being back in Thailand.   A special treat... There's this strange (to me) drink in Thailand that they call "Nam Pan."  I never saw it in the USA until today. In English, at Viet-Thai Noodle House they call it "Bubble Tea."  The first time I had it was in Bangkok when a Thai friend got one for me from a street vendor. When I took my first sip, I suddenly felt these little "balls" in my mouth and they kinda tickled and felt so funny I started giggling.  It was like a fruit smoothie with these weird balls. I loved it. The balls are kinda soft and chewy. They're the size of blueberries. They're kinda gluteny and it turns out they're made from some kind of flour. This drink is a hoot.  At least try it once.  If you like smoothies you'll be hard pressed not to like "Nam Pan."  I'm DEFINITELY coming back. Grin.  Can't wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States. &#34;Bubble Tea&#34; Oh. Yes. First time I&#39;ve seen outside Thailand.

1rHPUqTRKni8SFRkHyE1TA.text: I am not a Thai connoisseur, I usually do not like it. But since I am headed to Thailand this summer I decided to try Thai from different places so I can get an idea of what to look for. The food is really good. Everything is flavorful. The servers were helpful and the food comes out quick and hot. Beware, if you're not into spicy food even the mild has a kick. This is place has some of the best Pad Thai.   I liked this place, I even tried one of the smoothies. They do not taste like an American smoothie with the same name and they are much looser in consistency. They have a unique taste, but I would definitely get another one.

vGVNjXQ7hna_auclSur4vw.text: I went because there were great reviews on the beef pho. I honestly don't know where these people had Pho before but they must all be subpar.  I must say that I was very disappointed. I've had Pho At various restaurants across the U.S. and this was the worst. The broth was not flavorful AND needed more salt. Pho is known for broth and the complex depth of flavor!!! The beef was tough and in big random ununiform pieces. Very unappetizing. The staff and service were great though.

QGeMp6ZHhSon54hzfmCs4g.text: At first, I would come here out of pure convenience to get my pho fix but after going to other nearby Vietnamese spots (Doan's and Saigon Grill), I think Viet-Thai makes one of the better phos in the area. Their broth, which any pho fanatic would tell you is the MOST important part, has depth and is seasoned appropriately (although they can be a little too heavy-handed on the salt), their portions are massive and the cuts of beef are almost always perfect. Pair that with extremely friendly service, a thai menu that's not half bad and a fantastic bubble tea (taro!) -- you've got the ideal southeast asian food spot.

-VxBFKXm8tnQfbovEUuKAA.text: The pho was great! This is a simple, nothing fancy restaurant in a shopping center but it had the best pho I've had so far in Charlotte! Half of the fish tanks were sitting there empty as if they'd been formerly used which looked a little junky to me. In summary I wasn't impressed with the ambience but then again I also felt comfortable having my seven month old baby in there with us without the worry of him disturbing others. The "medium" sized pho was more than I could finish, granted we had the summer rolls as an appetizer. I wouldn't recommend the summer rolls as they were over-stuffed with iceberg lettuce. They were on a wait when we arrived but it went much faster than the 40 minutes they quoted. The bar was flooded with To Go orders. I personally pho is a great thing to get for carry out. The service was excellent. Some of their Thai noodle dishes looked great as well but we didn't try any.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Me and my yummy pho!! If you&#39;re feeling sick this soup has a way of making you feel better!

YjtIiu0t5WWiTbaGMEQsSQ.text: Excellent broth! I always order the combination pho. On a cold wet day, I aways think of this place! Their thai doses are only OK, I only come here for the pho.

b42RlOPFxv5QvT5hWsvo0A.text: i'm really skeptical when it comes to viet food but this place tasted great! The flavor was intense and I was super happy with the take-out order! I didn't try their bubble tea and the reason for that is it's made from powder. Anyone who is a bubble tea fanatic knows that good bubble tea is NEVER be made from powder.  I gave it a four stars because they didn't have the vietnamese sub and because i think the price is a bit high for the contents (rice noodles + vegetables = $10).

tghrzfnZv4n2UDDAQkrDSQ.text: I hoofed it out here last Saturday evening with a friend because we were both on the hunt for some good thai food and this place seemed to have the best reviews!  We ended up sticking with the basics--pad thai and I added shrimp to mine.  I thought it was good, not great.  The portions were plentiful but really it was mostly noodles with chunks of tofu (that I didn't want), nothing to really add the "crunch" I have grown to love in pad thai (peanuts, sprouts, onions, SOMETHING) and there were just a few pieces of egg thrown in the mix.  Overall I just wasn't super impressed.  I got mine rather spicy but the flavor still was more of the fish sauce than anything else.  Am I crazy for wanting pad  thai that is more "peanut" in flavor?  The shrimp was too fishy and I really wish I didn't add that to the dish.  It didn't do anything for it.  Overall, the meal was "good."  That's all.  I think I need to try some other things on the menu but I was honestly a little overwhelmed by some of the options.  I wasn't sure what would have been the best thing to order nor what would be the most authentic choice.  The server was friendly but it took a long time for the meal to come out.  The lights are super bright in this restaurant and there was a screaming kid the entire time.  Not pleasant.    Also, the wine was super warm.  It tasted like it had been heated up.  yuck.  I would still come back because I am pretty sure there are other things worth trying and even though this particular pad  thai was just "good" I haven't found much better in Charlotte as of yet.

Vbnzy2LElQVAudvHUmSy9Q.text: Awesome food and great service! Outdated decor. Old enormous fish tank with very sizeable  fish that  should be set free. The tank set up is a little hard to look at while eating. It's not very clean looking.

KKWLeVhpU__pAeqOGTzTrg.text: I love this place. Awesome little whole in the wall. Great Vietnamese food. Always delicious. The staff is friendly and fast. Plenty of space for large groups.

tGVCvlNE1PBeHJowl78lRQ.text: Pho-nomenal Pho Ga soup! Just what we needed on this cold,  damp day! Unsweetened ice tea has a refreshing vanilla flavor too. Been awhile since we have been out this way to eat here and I'm so glad we did!

oq6JHe0o3iTEYDFET3If-w.text: Sigh. We ordered takeout. Our curry containers were only barely half full. We're used to getting full containers. Especially for $12.75 each. Also, although the curry was okay. It's not the traditional curry that we usually get. There is something in here that is not in authentic curry. This is the second place in Charlotte where we've gotten this dark curry. It's disappointing. Also, the vegetable choice in my curry was horrible. One piece of broccoli, 2 slivers of carrots, lots of onions, very soft zucchini, one slice of green bell pepper, 2 slices of red, and an okay amount of potatoes. We'll try another place, with hopes of better luck. 3 stars are for the service. The woman was very nice taking our order. The pad Thai was uh.. Just okay. It had an off flavor. We got it for my son so maybe they tried to substitute something for the lack of spice. Overall not good for vegetarians or vegans. I got more rice than vegetables, lol which sucks considering there's barley any broth or veggies to eat all this rice with. Maybe the other dishes are better. We'll never know.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Curry comes only half full. For $12.75. Not worth it.

r_QHKH2lZc50ACzcxHvnVA.text: The food was pretty good for the price, they give you a lot of food and it tastes great! I ordered the Pad Thai and it tasted a lot better than the typical Pad Thai offered by restaurants. The one bad thing is that the restaurant was completely empty when we went, I'm not sure if that was typical or if it was just a slow day. All in all, the food is good and I recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pad Thai

1UI84YReGKIQSvkcIB1KYg.text: We came in on Sunday for dinner and it was not very busy. We ordered spring rolls and summer rolls which were delicious! I had the medium sized Pho Tai and it was a perfect portion size for me. The broth hit the spot and had good flavor. My only complaint is that I would've liked more meat in mine. My family has been coming to this place for years! The food is consistently good.

Pyk0Uo2PHvuhosGM0mJoHQ.text: Love this place. Super nice and friendly. And food is awesome! 10/10 definitely recommend for avid Viet-Thai food lovers

xhHm4xp8UIYmcwm-zSpVPw.text: I'm so sorry, but my son just asked me what my criteria is for a 5star review on yelp. So I told him a place we've been to multiple times, and enjoyed. So he says "so Viet-Thai  has five stars right?" I was bummed. I forgot to review a place I've been over a dozen times!     This place has yet to disappoint. Soups, rice, noodles and don't even mention the bubble tea. Everything is great. A place I bring family from out of town because I'm happy to give viet-Thai our money. They do a fantastic job. And the staff is great.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Delicious pad Thai, super spicy. The other half of the reason we go!!
Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bubble tea. Half the reason we go there in the first place
Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tom yum soup, with noodles. Spicy, so beware.

_ghwUCiLA08y7yl9xplOwg.text: Outstanding Pad Thai. My beautiful bride loves the Pho. Very reasonable prices, even in Sunday.

hjJ_Qtdy5d2l5NxKyfvHUg.text: Best pho in CLT. I'm a regular so I always get pho and papaya. please try it out if you ever stop in Charlotte.

5ESTFDZSP6UV6SBiRcXriA.text: Portions were good BUT prices were astronomical for a Sunday lunch since u pay dinner prices! Just three bowls of noodles came out to be $48.   The pho didn't hv the long simmered richness. The Tom Yum soup was very salty. And, the bun chao gao w/ chicken was tasteless after eating the tom yum!
