Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States

Siyji_wtqKKxIR03Qb5Xvg.text: Food was good and service was quick. They made sure nothing was awry at our table. We loved the spring rolls. The Thai chicken fried rice is good, made with a lot of soy sauce. The chicken pad Thai was also tasty. Portions are incredible leaving you enough to take home for seconds and maybe thirds. Prices are also very reasonable. This place is now my go-to place for Vietnamese/Thai food.

iCI4lLHq9tG4A9K0-9l0qQ.text: I ordered a number #61 & my parents ordered something on the pho menu. My mom ordered a seafood pho and my dad got the #2.   My food was pretty good because I love crispy noodles but the picture that alluded me to get it was misleading. In the picture there were mussels and plenty of shrimp. When I received the order, there were only two shrimps and NO MUSSELS. My heart absolutely broke, because the mussels were the only thing I was looking forward to and there were NONE! But the food was still good.   My parents pho was pretty good but honestly, nothing beats homemade pho.   The atmosphere of the place was mediocre. Our waitress seemed very rushed. Rushing us to the table, rushing us our food, and rushing us out. I thought that was pretty weird but it may not be. Besides I'm from a small town and things may be different in the city.   Overall it was pretty good, so I'm not complaining.

dVYgDdZqASIRRlr3leyXPQ.text: Ordered take out & it was delicious! We ordered the papaya salad and shrimp fried rice. Good portions & flavor

0eoYkpzlrFVS4dRMgL64IQ.text: Alright so compared to the first review i left nothing really changed, in a good way. I did try some more dishes here so lets review those. Starting off with appetizers, fried spring rolls are a classic. They're fried nice and crispy and the flavor is awesome and paired with that sauce is amazing! Then there's the fried shrimp wrapped in fried egg noodles and oh man... it is definitely delicious. Very unique looking dish but super super tasty. There's also summer rolls that come with a peanut sauce and those are, just like the other appetizers... delicious! Now on to entrees the pho is still absolutely amazing and I still haven't found one to beat it. I also tried the roast pork fried rice and it is so fragrant and comes with a flavor to match that fragrance. Last one is the pud kee mow the flavor is just amazing. You have got to try these dishes!

photos.caption: Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pho before all my sauce goes in it
Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried Shrimp wrapped in fried egg noodles

_e-IR7lJkfk3wiLU4iH8YQ.text: Great Vietnam Noodle house - I truly think it has the best PHO in Charlotte. It's filled with meat and noodles and the best broth around . The peppers and cilantro and mint and green onion are superb to add to it ! Please go - it is delicious !

_whBrfSH_nYgw-y6T6rU7Q.text: Really great food! Everything I have had has been some of the best. Staff can be kind of rude but it's worth dealing with for the food. If they were nicer it would be a 5 for sure!

8Tlcwq3REVasJ66zJIhdCQ.text: The staff here in this one room elaborately decorated restaurant all great you warmly, and I got the feeling that this was a family-run establishment.   I'll be honest, I nearly u-turned out of this shopping center BEHIND Burlington Coat Factory in favor of a less sketchy place... But do not u-turn. Do not pass go. Do not collect $200. Go straight in and order the Pho.   I advise against sitting at the bar as though I sat alone, I was crowded with endless to-go orders waiting to be claimed. I overheard the loud conversationalist behind me list to her fellow diner her "must try" menu items, claiming her expertise as a period of residency in Southeast Asia, which I think speaks to the authenticity of the cuisine.   The Pho GA was flavorful and steaming, perfect for the cool evening. The summer rolls seemed large, but they are mostly just overstuffed with lettuce; however the peanut sauce tasted homemade--the perfect compliment. The Pad Thai looked delicious, but I'll have to try that on my next visit to Charlotte.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fresh summer rolls

xKMgYWh5LNw1b8dCV45bTw.text: I've only been here for takeout but it was pretty good. We started off with the spring rolls which are Vietnamese style (with the vermicelli ride Noodles inside) and they were fantastic. The flavor and texture was great and I could have had 5 more! These were a great start to our meal.   I got the chicken pad Thai and my boyfriend had the chicken pad see ew. I thought both were very tasty and the noodles had a great consistency to them. The flavors were on point, but my only complaint would be that there wasn't much sauce with either dish so they were a little dry. I prefer my Thai noodles to be a little more moist than the ones at Viet Thai.   Other than that, this place seems like a good staple and I will definitely return when I'm in the area to try more Vietnamese food!

pXcNm9GJzl_RRyCRzBpLQw.text: This used to be a 4 star for me but my visit today became more of a 3.5 which was a disappointment. I grew up in this place, came here every weekend and was my favorite soup slurping bowl of goodness I could find in all of Charlotte. While it still tasted delicious, it felt a bit lacking and here's why:  I ordered the usual: the combination pho with all the fixins (because you know, if you do pho, you gotta do it right). It came with a huge heaping of bean sprouts (yum), fresh basil (lookin' good), and a few wedges of lime (aw yeah). Then, the pho came. Quite honestly, the pho looked a bit sad. I was looking for those thin slices of rawish beef still cooking in the broth but it just looks like the beef slices found in the supermarket and not what should be found in the pho. However, the flavors were still there. Oh man, the unami flavor of the broth was really there and that's basically what you want when you eat pho.   Would I come back here? Probably. Would it be my to-go place when I'm in town? Nah. While I will continue to go, I don't plan on going out of my way to eat here.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States. #49

eSno0NJIFyU2tpQZnzUoIw.text: Best Pho I ever had!! This is the first time writing a review about Viet-Thai Noodle House but I been here several times.   I ordered the specialty Pho vegetarian with Tofu. If you don't live near this place and want Pho to go you can place a take out order like I did. When I arrived my pho was separated, the noodles and veggies in a flat container, and the flavorful broth was in a large container. It can simply be mixed at home and served. I normally put the broth in a pot to get it nicely hot. Then add the noodles and the veggies to the broth. Let it simmer for a few minutes and put it in a nice deep bowl. It was enough for two people and some left over. So perfect for cold winter night or when I am feeling under the weather!!  The staff is friendly and professional.  Never been dissatisfied with Viet Thai Noodle House ... Delicious!!

photos.caption: Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Speciality Pho checkout review

DjoV3xfeSflWPv7tqEae4Q.text: The pho and curry was AMAZING! Super fast service too. We felt a little rushed, but the food made up for it.

w5sXF8bpBpBIF1mpAw1mNw.text: The only way you will be satisfied after leaving this place is to go in and expect the worst treatment from the waitstaff. Prices are high compared to other pho places, so we don't come here too often. Pho is incredibly delicious, which is why I always come back after previously leaving, emotionally abused. They mainly have just two waitress and they are taking care of the tables and the front desk for customers who do take out. Because of their location in Charlotte, they have a very diverse crowd. I think that as long as you're not Asian, you will be respected and cared for, so don't be scared to try Vietnamese/Thai for the first time.   Today, I ordered a pho dish that didn't include beef meat balls. I requested to have some added for additional cost. Waitress rolled her eyes at me (picture Liz Lemon's masterpiece eye roll). Our order wasn't complicated. We both ordered tea to drink and then two pho dish and one to have meat balls added. Eye roll was unnecessary for such a common request from pho eaters. Their pho is some of the best pho I've had, and that keeps me coming back. The broth isn't over powered by sweetness and cinnamon, which is how I prefer it. Their serving looks small but I am always full and satisfied at the end. My boyfriend always gets the seafood pho (pho do bien) and I always want to try some of his broth. It's so clean and light. Their summer rolls are very sad. It had noodles, the herbs, and ONE shrimp, cut in half. The peanut sauce that comes with the summer roll is so unique and flavorful. It's the only thing that adds flavor to their summer rolls. I would prefer not to order it but my boyfriend will take summer rolls anywhere he can get them.   Their service is a hit or miss (expect miss), but their food is enough to recommend to you.

vUcDgcqd9xHs7OZY1r8ZKA.text: I heard stories from my boyfriend on how wonderful this place is for several years but since there are several Thai and Vietnamese places closer we never ventured the 20 mins out to Pineville. Let me tell you it is worth the trip.  The summer/basil rolls were bigger than any I have had before and on point.  They had a ton of different Pho options and I was extremely please with the one I selected.  The staff was extremely nice and coming from someone who doesn't drink sweet tea, what ever they put in theirs is amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pho kind of day
Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pho section of menu

c2IlUsDhRR9y-I6ONNoADw.text: Curry was meh and I don't get all the comments about giant portions. Food is way over priced. Papaya salad was ok although almost half of it was a solid chunk of lettuce as if to fill up space. Shrimp was minimal and still had tails??? Seriously tiny shrimp hidden in the salad and I had to find each one and remove the tail.

yUZgt03JUwQsla5rMFBhoQ.text: beautiful environment, great options on the menu I will defiantly be back. The curry dish I tried was not my favorite but I've heard so many great reviews that I want to go back !! See ya soon.

35kRWyeS9d8r7OGXKSOx-Q.text: Not authentic Thai! Spring rolls are dry and nasty, the summer rolls were just ok, and the pad kaprao was horrible. We had to send it back because the beef was so tough and not edible. Even the tea was disgusting and had to be returned. When we spoke to the manager about the beef being tough, she made it clear that the beef was not tough. The staff was NOT friendly. The restaurant was so cold we had to wear our big winter coats at the table. Several tables complained, but they said it was nothing they could do because the air was connected to the kitchen. It was colder in the restaurant than outside. We went there because the reviews were good, but I would NEVER go back even if they gave out free food!

tK4WEh34fJXzA1Uswdlomg.text: Excellent vegetarian pho and shrimp rolls. Found it unfortunate that they did not honor lunch prices on Sunday, but we had a great experience. Green curry was great too!

T6il5L3kDpwYym1Hhp9GKg.text: Absolutely loved it. Most authentic food besides home food! Atmosphere was welcoming and the food was fantastic! I had the Pad Kee Mow with tofu and it was just.....yum. My friend had the chicken Pad Thai and that was just......yum. If you like Thai tea....get it. So perfect!

ZZ3Uqby3F-k_bLSD0aMDEQ.text: Great food and generous portion sizes that is accompanied by friendly service. Had 2 noodle dishes and a curry.  Authentic spice so be careful of the degree of heat you choose. We are leaving with lots of left overs.

x8119AJSiOpM59Yrtoisdw.text: I go here much more often than is good for the waist line.  Food is great and consistent, service is very good, and the people are nice.

EAZwO0kDSW1LHuTLp9n-uw.text: One main dish I never get tired of is Pho. Pho is my favorite noodle soup I ever have. The Pho is fantastic and I enjoyed their drinks like bubble tea or Thai coffee. They serve both both Vietnamese and Thai dishes, so they varieties just in case your not in a mood for noodles.  Good service, good food, overall a good  good restaurant.

buCHRKcDQh9BLXUWm2CQHw.text: Oh burning hot Asian goodness! Three star hotness is all I could handle - and that's all I need. A local fix for that layered complex spicy goodness of Thai.   A pad Thai with layers of complexity is what you'll get if you order the peanut classic - beware you may feel that previous Thai experiences weren't as hot. We were served a mount of noodly goodness that would be enough for two, so I can't wait for leftovers for lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States. From my booth

sdRz7Fo18QRM8uwRmRoQ9Q.text: Two stars for service and one for food. Always looking to fuel my Asian food cravings, I've had this place on my list for a while. A lazy Friday night in Ballantyne, I was really excited to finally visit this place. With almost 200 reviews and  4 stars, I was expecting a lot better. I really wanted to love this place, but I thought it was just Okay. The service was wonderful, really nice, friendly and fast. The food on the other hand I thought was not very fresh and left a lot to be desired. We started with the spring rolls, those were good. Col got the yellow curry and it was really spicy- that is to be expected. I got the pad see ew. I didn't like this at all. It didn't taste good and it was really lacking veggies. Our meals were around 13.00 dollars, not horrible, but I was expecting a lot better.  Between  Jade and Basil within a 10 mile radius, I don't think I'll be visiting again.  Maybe I just had a bad experience, but I was disappointed with the food quality.

HA9v_SLghdWHnoTcoZU1mQ.text: There is only one word for the food here, PHENOMENAL! My husband and I have lived and eaten all over the globe and all over the US. Thai and Vietnamese rank among the top cuisines we absolutely love and hence we seek it out in every city we have ever visited. So when we had to go to Charlotte, NC for work and decided to stop by this place for dinner, we were not expecting authentic food. I would have settled for passable, this is Charlotte, not Los Angeles or New York or DC.   When we walked in the door we saw that the place was packed at 6 PM on a Thursday night. Now this was a great sign. And there were many Vietnamese families among the guests, now this is an excellent sign! We ordered Bun tom thit ga nuong (chicken and shrimp with vermicelli) and pad ke mow (shrimp drunken noodles). Oh my goodness, from the first bite to the last, what an explosion of taste! I would rate the food here among the best Vietnamese and Thai I have ever eaten! And for the fraction of the price I have paid in the past.  We finished with the mango sticky rice, once more phenomenal! The customer service is attentive and friendly, with an exception of a lady who brought our check at the very end, who was not the most friendly out there but its okay. The two gentlemen ( an older guy who could only be the owner and a younger guy probably the owner's son), were attentive and helpful through-out.  I would have happily given them 5 stars but refrained because of the interior decoration. The decor was dated and in a very run down tattered state. They've got to invest in making this place look decent. Right now it looks like a place that belongs in the back alley somewhere, does nothing for ambiance or the customer's experience.  But if all you needed was exceptional food (sans ambiance), you've found the right place. Charlotte.. you've impressed me! Who would have guessed you could hide such authenticity within you!

5k5RUdfZ7bPebUTSMiobvw.text: Delicious Thai and Vietnamese, this is our third visit today for lunch.  Food is really good, my menu favovites  Really enjoy:  Fried Rice, delicious Chicken Fried Rice with big chunks of onion and tomotoe #51 Chicken Pho w Pad Thai with Chicken and Shrimp Summer Spring Rolls

7CRS8z1nmIq6hTAbWQPRpg.text: Best Pho in Charlotte!!! The food is so fresh and authentic. This is my new haunt! Highly recommended.

PBzWr_lgxiqVSAKF5mLlSg.text: I love pho. And I love pad thai! And Viet-Thai Noodle House hits the spot for both! The food is always consistent and the service is very attentive and friendly. My hubby and I come here quite often and we leave with a full belly. The portions are good, although I could eat more than 2 spring rolls in their standard order. If you're looking for good authentic Vietnamese and Thai in South Charlotte, look no further.

dUNv5Cvi8NSaTzalZhOC1g.text: Food here is great. They have the variety of different kind of food from Thai, Vietnamese, and a few of Laos food.  The price is good for the portion they served.  The only thing I didn't like is they don't have enough server when crowded like lunch time. I had to ask for my drink to be refill a couple times.

o-nfXTjB5jneW8XurKpbUw.text: I have the #49 pho every time I go there. It's really good. Next time I will try the grilled pork on rice! The only downside is the bathroom is dirty...

bTv1KswilCTkP9SUI0BvBw.text: This was the first thai restaurant that I had been too. So I was very unsure of what I was going to be tasting. For appetizer my party and I went with the summer rolls, which were amazing! And a papaya salad which was really good! Although my friend went with thai spicy.. Woo was it spicy!!! For my entree I went with chicken pad thai and it was very flavorful! I loved it! Our server was really helpful and attentive! I will definite be going back!

Ku6-Wu6UoQn0a63fgElbGw.text: Great place!  A little pricey, but consistently good food.  One time had a boba drink that was not great though.

CRSTbum0R34kMZdA1pTPlQ.text: Viet-Thai is a pretty nice laid back kind of place.  I love going there and eating the pho.  When it's cold out, this restaurant is the place to be to warm you up.  All the goosebumps go away once I start slurpin stuff...PHO'sho!    My husband also got me addicted to their appetizer.  I don't know the name, but it has shrip with crispy noodles wrapped around it.  Delish!

JKn-dDFdaeNr9IT5NsY-Rw.text: Fantastic pho, among other things, and friendly service. I have been coming here since before I moved to Charlotte and have continued. The atmosphere leaves a bit to be desired, which is making this a 4 star instead of a 5 star review, but ideally I'd give them 4.5.

VTumWGsdkDAqMnt6BiMGIQ.text: It's alright I guess. My bun bo hue was a touch too bland and my friends basil pork thing was several touches blander. All the more curious because the chicken larb was pretty solid tasting and flavorful.

j3wk8BMjnGK-0xiJSvQtPA.text: Our family go to Viet Thai Noodle House at least every two weeks. The Noodle(Pho) here is great tasting and is my favorite among the Vietnamese restaurants in Charlotte.   I loved the plate of bean sprouts and fresh Thai basil that is served with the soup.   I recently discovered that this place has the best Larb and sticky rice than all of the Thai restaurants that I normally go to (I am Thai BTW). Tom Kah Gai here is spicier than at Thai House and Thai Taste and contained fresh Kah and Lemon Grass with more coconut milk in the broth. Som Tum(Papaya Salad) that is made here is the closest to Som Tum made in northern Thailand. I ordered 4 stars one time and had sweats running down my neck half way through eating it.  For those who like to see famous faces, this is also a favorite restaurant for Ben Bernanke when he visits his family in Charlotte.

xDMqZJ_6m2i8WAjkxvdWWg.text: hands down, one of my favorite places to get thai and vietnamese fare. no frills,no fuss. tasty and affordable, and they also have yummy boba drinks. last time i went, they had added some fun flavors like avocado, durian, and jackfruit.

3wKPCSAqjVkgyN-C5ZVABQ.text: This is my go to spot when I want Pho! They have tons of great dishes. I have tried many of their dishes and am always pleased. Great service, and great food.

bGoNIjuS4AbDX1rZazY7xw.text: One of the best Viet places I've been too! The wait time is kind of long, so wouldn't recommend it if you were in a hurry... but def worth waiting for! Their Pho is amazing

n7au0h45yihEShrQQ7u_lQ.text: This place has the best pho I've ever had! The flavors meld perfectly and the veggies and meats are very fresh. I usually have the vegetarian pho, just because I love how the tofu tastes after absorbing all the broth, mmmm! Even their thai iced tea is great. Since my boyfriend loves Thai food and I'm crazy about pho, this is a good place to please both our cravings. The last time we went there we ordered the summer rolls as appetizers which were just like they are everywhere else. My boyfriend had the red curry with a spice level of 4. It was wayyy spicier than he expected but he enjoyed it nevertheless. It was delicious. The next time he tried something called Pad Kratiem Prik Thai (okay I had to Google that since they don't have a menu online and the name is so uncommon), which is chicken with garlic and white pepper. It was mind blowing! This makes me realize something, since I always get the veggie pho, I hardly know about any of the other dishes here but whatever I have tried from my companion's order, I have consistently loved. I don't think there is anything here that I haven't liked and even thinking about it all is making my mouth water right now. Even the owners and servers are very friendly and the service is very prompt. I highly recommend this place for anyone looking for some flavorful Vietnamese or Thai food.

UsuTUNZHQRTpLc6Flqmrig.text: We come here almost every week. Consistent great service and food. It you're looking for fresh authentic Pho, this is the place!! Yum

OTQwbSk0fQcW2ZsDlY-Kzw.text: Their chicken wings are fantastic!!!! They are sweet but not too sweet, hot but not too hot, and their seasoning is uncommon but delicious!  They are very consistent with the level of heat used each time we come, a level 3 is always a 3. The Vermicelli Salad is excellent, as is their Pad See Ew.  Their Pad Thai was good, but didn't knock my socks off. Every time we come all the tables around us are ordering the Pho, it seems to be very popular and I am definately going to try it next time.

mnIE1nOh8uFM4TjDBSVE4w.text: Amazing!! Everything we have ordered from this place has been delicious.  This is are go to Thai place in south Charlotte. The staff is well trained and can answer any question you have and also gives great recommendations. The atmosphere is nothing fancy or upscale but the food is very good truly authentic tastes! We love it!  Try this place!!

ubqX5B_f7X03CdYoouiGLg.text: My wife and I were visiting Charlotte and decided to try this place out due to such great Yelp reviews. We are glad we did. I had the grilled chicken rice dish with an egg roll and my wife had the pad Thai, both were fabulous. Service A, food A, ambiance B-. Overall we would definitely come back!

pxXrGfVAjkzG1AydeYlBSA.text: This restaurant renewed my interest in Vietnamese cuisine (after being disappointed in last couple Vietnamese restaurants I've tried). It's out of the way a bit, but worth the extra effort to find.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beef Fried Rice

GtYqV30QIjRBPVccJcALdQ.text: Broth was very good. Meaty, a bit oily, heavy on the cilantro and green onion, no black pepper, no clove or other depth but a distinct lime touch. Meat was a touch thick but great quality. Bean sprouts were wet, which is weird. Peppers great.  Rolls; pretty meh. Great size, but small shrimps, no pork, shredded lettuce, basic fish sauce, no spices.  Ice coffee needed more milk, could have been deeper flavored coffee too  Definitely my best pho experience in Charlotte to date

cNTLlfZsLNfXlhi_oL9jeQ.text: This place can be hard to find and tucked away in a shopping center. I am not a big fan of the vegetarian curry dishes- could be better. But the soups are amazing. And the soup portions are ginormous!

ccYE6TlwcnE7Wuq-T3Ejyg.text: Very nice place.  We had lunch and thoroughly enjoyed it.  Food arrived fast.  The seafood noodle soup I had was rich and flavorful.  Good service.  Everything was just right.

5rrlysDpsKwdBx4w9cqmYA.text: I always love coming here. The food is always fresh and superb. I usually get the pad Thai or pho. They should be busier as this place is a hidden gem in Charlotte . Also a fan of the jasmine tea !

2i6XeGRL8CRjHdcNP7vI8w.text: Probably some of the BEST Thai I have ever had...and I LOVE Thai food.  Wished I still lived in Charlotte...I would be there weekly!

chZruReG-8POlzF8PxeNgA.text: Amazing food. Very friendly people. Great ambience. It's behind the Burlington coat factory opposite Lowes. Strongly recommended. ..

Z1r-WBXMvPf5ixNgzvNmrQ.text: I could literally live here and die a happy woman eating the Pho Ga.

rQb2VwH3J13chM2sLrOTKw.text: Always satisfied. I love the Pho and Number 27 Vietnamese salad with noodles.  I drive over 30 miles to eat!!!!

05CeqGgsUilvih7xl9Khag.text: Viet thai has mine and my girlfriend's spot for years and we never really told anyone. My parents asked us out to dinner one night and we discovered it had also been their spot for years. My girlfriend is crazy for the pad Thai, and I'm crazy for any noodle soup. Friendly service

nkWUFfBa8UYGujVARHyl1Q.text: I am giving this place 5 stars! It is my favorite noodle house and even though I don't live as close by anymore still make my way down when I can. I have it down to a science. As soon as you walk in the door you are greeted by great staff.  It appears it is a family owned business which I always appreciate.   Here you will find some of the best and largest summer/basil rolls. The peanut sauce completes it and is on point.  Pro-tip- get an extra order so you will have them for lunch the next day. Then as you open this rather large menu you will have lots of choices to chose from. Hint- you can't go wrong but I typically go with one of the Pho options.  Sometimes I get the House Special and top it off with the fish sauce. The fish sauce is a must and so good. So back to the Pho, its my favorite Pho Dac Beit which includes the rare beef, well-done beef, meatballs, tendon, cilantro, and love to add sprouts, sirachi, and hoison.  It is in this broth that is to die for. I have even got the pho to go before and they provide a "kit" so you can put it all together when you get home.  Last but definitely not least you should make sure to get the sweet tea. Even if you don't like sweet tea order this version as this is a "thai version". i wish i knew the recipe. Whatever the mix of chinese herbs are you cant beat this tea. I have several glasses while enjoying my meal and they even make me a to go cup.  On this brisk day I am craving some pho and sweet tea so I know where I will be going!

photos.caption: Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States

Aa9CQOXunALqkWS6Sm-zVw.text: Have been here more than 30 times and always it's the same... The Best! My personal favorite is their Phos, curries and stir fry. You can pick any one of these and you'd never go to any other Thai restaurant  Love their environment and cozy decor. Special mention to my wonderful friend Vicky.. she's the star of Viet Thai!

a4x5A4_gTJQIJ35zW9LOHg.text: Been wanting to try this place forever, but its a little drive for us. We finally made it on a quiet Friday night (4th of July weekend). Well worth the drive. Our service was great! Started with the  shrimp summer rolls. Very good and fresh.   I opted for the #28. Way too much food for me, but delicious! Great option for summer because although its a ton of food it has a light taste. Vermicelli noodle bowl with lettuce, cilantro, cucumbers, topped with chicken, pork, beef and shrimp as well as an egg roll. Fish sauce on the side. HUGE bowl of food for $13.   Boyfriend got chicken pad thai, and it was really good!  Will definitely go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States. #28 Bun dac biet

bDMcALDITItJoikJJzMNbg.text: The food is very good her but unfortunately this restaurant has unpredictable hours and closes :15-:20 earlier than their posted hours. The food is good but I've been disappointed 3+ times when the open sign is on but when I park and walk-in I'm told "the kitchen is closed".

photos.caption: Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States

eJ2vfTDVMZLWJtLjNKQm3A.text: I have honestly never written a bad review about a business on Yelp. I was taught that if you cannot say anything nice, say nothing. I can't stay silent in this case. While the food was good, the service was so rude and disrespectful, I am stunned. The restaurant was very busy, got it.  We were "greeted" by one of the servers, pointing to an empty table in one direction but she was walking in a completely opposite direction..so I wasn't sure if we should follow her or take the empty table she pointed to behind us. Ok, sat at the empty table after she scolded us for following her.   As soon as we put our butts on the seats, a wait person approached wanting to know our drink and meal order. We asked for a minute and she proclaimed she was too busy and walked away.     She returned a few minutes later and asked what we wanted. We ordered drinks. She asks what we wanted to eat. Again requested that we needed a few minutes. She was not happy.    She comes back with the drinks, puts them "loudly" on the table. Asked my husband if he was ready. Thank heavens he had an answer. She asked me what I wanted and I hesitated. Man was she pissed. We almost walked out. We should have.   I won't continue because there isn't anything good to say. We won't go back.

GjRmLZ69ZeYQiDi_AhffiA.text: Plainest egg rolls and spring rolls I've ever had. I expect more than iceberg lettuce and 3 shrimps. Pad Thai was the worst I've ever had as well. It tasted like burnt fish sauce noodles with a dash of ketchup. Chicken wings and papaya salad were good but this will be my first and last visit.

LzcyGtvOQw6M2R2-SCWsBA.text: Ordered pad Thai and shrimp egg plant dish. Pad Thai chicken was stale. Service was below par as well. Prices are higher than other Thai restaurants. Would not recommend. Shrimp eggplant was ok.

ANuRRKXe8pU4Hc1vuQmhXA.text: Viet-Thai has the most authentic Pad Thai I've found in this region. Apparently different regions of Thailand prepare it different ways, and VT makes it the way I was initially introduced to the dish, without the bright red color to it. Be sure to order it with spice, because otherwise it will come without. And make sure you order the dinner size if you want leftovers for later. I also love their summer rolls, and their unique Thai sweet tea.

ycZqw9I1orXy034FAj53dQ.text: Over priced.  $14 out the door for some pad Thai mostly noodles hardly any veggies. Seem clean inside. Employees delightful

KsA0zr6aTufBxyEn2u-7Fw.text: It was pretty good. The panang chicken curry and pad Thai were good choices. There is a variety of spice levels to choose from and make your dish spicy.

tc9H1UMeY04OCMKB9_l_Tw.text: My son loves pho, but he didn't love Viet-Thai Noodle House (and he's easy to please). The broth wasn't that great. The beef was chewy. The bean sprouts weren't fresh. He didn't like their spring rolls either, which were filled with mostly vegetables and very little meat. The service was as bad as the food. We didn't get any napkins until we were finally able to flag a waitress down at the end of our meal. (I have kids. You NEED napkins. Lots of them.) The waitress also poured water into a cup of Sprite, and she apologized but didn't offer a new drink. Needless to say, we won't be coming again.

3Lferupi4gC8gBX-tfPUlw.text: Stopped in here for lunch because I was feeling a bit under the weather and wanted to try their vegetarian/tofu pho but ended up ordering the Pad see ew.  My daughters were with me and they both got the pho so I figured I'd try theirs. The waitress was very nice though a bit persistent in trying to get our orders while we barely had time to look at the menu but she wasn't rude at all.  I told her that I wanted level Thai spicy and as usual, I get the, 'are you sure?' look.  This happens no matter where I go, it's like they just can't believe it can be handled by an American. But then again maybe they've had one too many dishes sent back because the patron truly bit off more than they could chew.  Well my order came out and it looked spicy and tasted delicious but it wasn't Thai level 5 spicy.  I added some of the chili oil she brought out as back up and it added a little more heat to it.  One negative was that there were far too many vegetables in the dish, they overpowered the noodles.  The same with the vegetarian pho.  The mushrooms weren't sliced and broccoli weren't bite sized and it just was overloaded with veggies but the broth was soooo delicious.  We saved it and I strained it and heated it up in a mug the next morning and drank it. So delicious.  So I only had a taste of two things on the menu but the taste and service deserves a 4 but the overwhelming veggie to noodle ratio and the lunch time prices(a bit much) are why I took off a star.  I'll update if anything changes.  That is all!  (Don't forget to hit the useful, funny or cool button.  Would love the feedback.)

E_bR_p-oFeQjdy_22QdSXg.text: I love their food, but why can't they get their act together with health inspectors. Repeat violations ... I didn't want to give this place up, but it's not all that hard to get good scores.

Vgxkj2hh3Fc1HGhCFRYSEg.text: Excellent food, got the vermicelli salad and it was excellent. I thoroughly enjoyed the flavors. It has an extensive menu with lots of Vietnamese and Thai food to pick from. Everything from curry to pad thai to pho and etc. They have milk tea aswell. Lots of atmosphere. The staff was very helpful and she helped me pick a menu item that read my mind and was exactly what i was looking for and hit the spot oh so well. Definitely reccomend this place as the food was hot and tasted amazing, I got it spicy and it was served with a side of hot oil and chili oil. So much flavor i cannot wait to go back. I definitely want to try the pho or the soup next time because another guest walked in and didnt even need a menu and he got a massive lunch soup with tons of fresh ingredients and it smelled fantastic. I got the rare beef pho to go for a buddy and it was excellent. Came with some rare beef and some excellent hot minty broth and tons of beans sprouts.  I'll be coming back next week for sure.
