ThmsUqwuM39sVqWnpAlCJg.text: My friend and I went to Viet-Thai for lunch on a Friday afternoon. We were seating right away at a table up front. The service was very quick. We ordered summer rolls with tofu to start, which were fresh and delicious. I loved the peanut sauce that went with it. After eating our summer rolls, my friend's daughter started to freak out because there was a roach on the wall by our table. It took us awhile before we got someone's attention, and when the guy saw it he just squashed it with his bare hand, which freaked out her daughter. He said they sprayed for bugs outside, so they make their way inside. Um, ew.   I ordered pad thai with chicken spicy level 3. It was definitely spicy and tasty, but I was not impressed. It did not have much dimension to it. The lunch order was huge, though, and it gave me plenty to take home.   Overall, it was not bad. I wouldn't mind going back, but I won't go out of my way.

CKIcPgL-JMv1lmcXoCJTTQ.text: We ordered takeout from here last night after our poker game, the order was made quick. It was a 10 minute wait after the phone call in. We ordered pad kee mao at spice level 3 for $12.75 and a thai iced tea for $3.50. Our total came out to 17 bucks, reasonable prices for dinner..and looks like all menu items are around 8-9 bucks for lunch. Our food came in one of those half styrofoam containers and the drink was pretty big. The container was packed to the brim with delicious drunken noodles, great flavor and spice. You'd probably get more food if you dine in. They also put in more noodles than veggies/chicken, which I like. You can also get extra noodles for $2 add on, worth it if you are sharing. We didn't opt for it since I wasn't that hungry.   All in all, very good and will be back. Cheers!

_7_FMyl0OQ5ZZNteo5Jmnw.text: Love this place. The fried rice and pad Thai are amazing! They are always very flexible to accommodate my vegetarian husbands request. Love their soups too.

f11FW2xm1no4mP8PWqNJjw.text: We have started to branch out and try new kinds of food thought we would give this place a try. It didn't disappoint at all. The menu was so cute it's made out of some kind of wood. And the food was very good also it was bright and colorful. My food was served to me on a fish plate y'all and that made my day. If you are adventurous and wanna try something new I'd say check this place out.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States

ZA-TdmU4i03MwW-7hFFTTw.text: My girlfriend and I stopped by here after traveling back from Myrtle Beach. We were starving and this hit the spot! The pho was absolutely delicious and the meat was of good quality. I definitely recommend the large size house special. I also like that when you order a soda they actually bring you the bottle with a cup, so you can take it home if you don't finish it all. Will definitely be back on our next trip.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States. House special pho (size large)

M9j2yIqLQNaO95rMQk2Ojg.text: I've been going here for about 7 years now and have to get my fix once a week. I don't normally write reviews, but this place definitely deserves taking the time to rave on of how delish and fresh this place is! #1 hang over cure, vermicelli noodle bowl with chicken (the hoisin lemongrass glaze )! Panaeng Curry is delish if you want to try something different. Of course best PHO, pad Thai, and Peanut sauce!!

QqOhiHPUBYbhMNKGpCa1hw.text: This is be far my favorite place to eat in Pineville! The Vermicelli noodle salads are my favorite- I've actually dreamt about them. Best pad Thai in Charlotte too for the price. The staff is friendly, and it's always better helping out a local business! It's a must visit!

JTvo9e4ZKPDLAvlFRW7O2Q.text: Three and 1/2 stars - still better than Deejay Thai in my book.  I personally don't care for hybrid restaurants but at least Vietnam and Thailand are neighbors and totally unlike Japan's, their cuisine share similarities   Based on taste alone I would have easily rated it 4 stars but ... first impression is not so great. The place is dark and dingy, you're greeted by two banquettes with ripped seats by the door plus the Thai menu is extremely limited - only one page long.  I wanted to try a duck dish -as always- but they don't serve any. M'kay, so we ordered a shrimp Tum Yum, a Pad Thai and a Shrimp and Eggplant stir fry and asked for everything to be spiced Medium hot.    We were served a good size bowl of Tum Yum with the usual tomato chunks, mushrooms and shrimps but much more important also galanga, lemongrass, lime leaves, chili etc. Now THAT's how Tum Yum is made - caveat: it was a little heavy handed with lemongrass which could make it too strong for some. I've had better, but not much better and not in Charlotte.  The Pad Thai was excellent, no other way to describe it. Lighter than the one we enjoyed at Thai orchid a few days earlier, but better for it. The Japanese eggplant  was served with shrimp, onions and green and red peppers in a sweet chili sauce that left us with a sweet after taste. It was obviously stir fried to order and the eggplant was simply delicious, but for some reason I wished the red peppers had been cooked a little longer. The final result didn't make me think of "a dish" as much as of different ingredients sharing the same plate.   Service was as expected, no complaints. We were charged dinner prices , $8 for the soup, about $13 for a dish because this was on a Sunday, which was fine because they made it up in quantity : we couldn't finish it all.   To sum it up great food, wish it was closer. I think the limited menu and sad decor won't warrant what is a 20 mile round trip for us ... not unless we're badly craving for Tum Yum.

dMhOs79fJh_uHw4g1CP2iA.text: Vegetable and tofu pho is my favorite. The broth is not bland like other vegetable base soups. Rice noodles are never over cooked. And the crispy spring rolls are the BEST. Perfect every single time. Good service as well. Bubble tea is also good the tapioca is not too chewy or soggy.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Curry with onions and scallions

7x0Jf9r_alBsFot627fTMA.text: I was excited to try this place and even talked a friend who had never had pho to come along. I read the reviews about the pho and was looking forward to finally finding a place close to me. I got the veggie pho and found it to be rather bland. Although I love cilantro, I was really hoping that this pho would taste llike more than just cilantro broth. I added some lime and chili sauce to the broth which helped a little but it was not as good as the phos I've had at other places. I also tried the papaya salad based on the reviews I had seen. It was very interesting and I've never tasted anything like it. The peanuts and shrimp with the papaya were an interesting combination that I think I can do without. I most likely will not be back.

MvZ4gk5RTlfl3R97EyBKQw.text: Rainy day. What could be better than Pho?  Unassuming place, located in a strip mall. Ordered the rare beef & meatball Pho and the wife ordered the chicken Pho. Both had excellent  flavor. The kids ordered Hawaiian fried Rice (cashews, raisins & pineapple) VERY flavorful as well. Kids also got bubble tea and we got Thai Iced Tea. Impressed with the size of the Thai teas.  Overall I will give 4 stars to any restaurant that has a bottle of Sriracha (liquid crack) on the table, but this place deserves it also for their authentic, fresh and flavorful food. The only gripe is that it was a little pricey(no kids menu?) but then again its tough to find authentic Pho in the South. We'll be coming back-

anRjSYodFj6QXm_wb4eH-g.text: First visit. In Town for weekend  Restaurant could be cleaner. Needs dusting and vacuuming. Also, food spills on the wooden menu are not appetizing. Friendly waitress. Wondering about kitchen cleanliness...  Pad Thai was tasty and plentiful. No complaints there. I just want to feel better about the hygiene of the place. Clean it up guys!

photos.caption: Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wooden menu cover!

DagqI7nL4v1QFqcX-9LMvA.text: First time here and really enjoyed. I should start writing down the names of what I order because I have no idea what they are called once I leave! Started with spring roll, super hot and a tad bit greasy, friend had the wonton soup (I don't eat seafood) and they LOVED it, said unlike any they had before... it had a lot going on, won tons, shrimp, looked very hearty. We both ordered off the Thai menu, she had chicken, veggies  in a garlic sauce... the sauce was nice and light, broth like and full of flavor. I ordered chicken, veggies, in a brown sauce level 3 spicy wide pan noodles. All the food came out hot and the veggies were very fresh and not overcooked. Apps came out quickly, it took a while for entrees to come out, they were not very busy so I assume from everything being made fresh. I would love to go back and try some of the Vietnamese dishes.

fIATy2X-FhdqvkeyoepJJA.text: What a find! We stumbled onto this place when the restaurants we were interested in were doing that annoying "closed until 5" thing. Well, I now have these annoying restaurants to thank for finding this little gem. My companions had two different types of pad Thai and I had the vegetarian tofu pho. All so good! :-) We shall return!

lYSrlMHA1fNQadGScBSmfw.text: This is my third time here and I don't know what happen but the food was not good. The chicken pad thai tasted like fish and was bland. The beef fried rice had bits of burnt in it. And the egg rolls where run of the mill ones you can find at any Chinese place, what happened to the nice Vietnamese egg rolls that they use to have. So conclusion need to find a new Vietnamese place.

-q-Swx3xJeZ98Nmh5s_PKw.text: This place smells like heaven.  Get the Tom kha soup. So good. It's a blend of Vietnamese and Thai so everyone in your party will be happy. It's a little restaurant on the backside of a plaza, but always has guests.   Definitely recommended over other Thai places in the area.

6BOpWw0rroEcBJqBaRg3OA.text: Our go-to date night spot. I get Vietnamese and my husband gets Thai... We love getting it to-go but eating there is always a treat as well!

G068_D9GJBltGwjjuHZ4WA.text: If you like Pho this is the place for you, Pho is a fresh Vietnamese soup and this place does it well and fast. The price will not kill you either, around $13 for a bowl and an ice tea. It will fill you up and service is good.

NV_bNc5AlSOb7V84e-TFWQ.text: Hands down the best around. If you like spicy try the secret code "20 hot" when ordering you will not regret it.

8NbutVA9KR9lAXK5_AHmyg.text: I wasn't expecting this quality of food it was awesome but a little pricey $52 for 2 sups, beef noodles and 2 teas, but overall it was good food

dUJ8ti1qbWcLZ0fRN1T72Q.text: Amazing spring rolls! The best I've had. Delicious Thai tea. Service is always great and the waiters and waitresses are very pleasant and friendly. Love this place!!

tg1OIMKHsfVkY1__G00MqA.text: We had the fresh spring rolls, bun bo hue, and pho dac biet.  They were all good, but not great.  They also tasted not quite Vietnamese like they were a Thai Vietnamese fusion.  The bun bo hue did not have blood cubes which is what would be expected and the base of the soup seemed similar to tom yum soup.  I can't quite figure out how the pho tastes different than the pho I expect.  It is different and again it tastes good, but not great and different.  Will try the Thai food next time.  If you expecting traditional pho and bun bo hue this is not the place, but if you are ok with good food that is coherent out I'd worth a try.

ZTBJW3hSRwr92YGyz71usA.text: Great selection of high quality Vietnamese and Thai cuisine. Service was excellent and the prices were very reasonable! The ambience could use a little work, and the bar area could use some updating. I think if the bar area was upgraded with a larger bar, better lighting (it very bright over the bar), and more bar stools, this would improve the overall appeal of the restaurant.

DtksT-EfQaGeFUuH97HBzA.text: I ordered the pork bun....it wasn't fabulous.  The pork didn't have much flavor and wasn't cooked long enough to char the fat.  Carrot strips weren't crunchy but we're real thin and so offered no texture.  The cucumber and cilantro were great.  Not sure I'd go back with better options around.

gnPEyJ7000pbKoEwt8Yw7g.text: A perfect combination of Thai and Vietnamese cuisine, you'll never get tired of the menu!  And treat yourself to a green bubble tea...tastes like ice cream!

xAEJi38Hr_EWxG9KAlrJww.text: This is our favorite restaurant.  If Yelp had 6 stars, we would give it.  The pho is incredibly good and fresh.  It's freaking addictive.  The family that runs the restaurant greets us with such enthusiasm each time we come. Be sure to ask the waitress for recommendations.  Let us recommend some dishes.  For appetizers, try Tom Kha Gai (#9) or Yum Woon Sen (#16).  The Pho Do Bien (#51) is a no brainier.  Totally addictive.  They have a dish nicknamed "drunken noodle" that is off the hook good.  Don't remember the number though.  The curry dishes are awesome.  Try them as-is.  This is an authentic Vietnamese restaurant so they turn up the heat.

a0iTbF-i2hhG_kdAhKRj9Q.text: The food here is so good! My only gripe is that they close too early. I've been coming here for years and it's consistently delicious every time.   Fave foods here include:  Papaya Salad - ask for it without shrimp cause the shrimp alters the True flavor of the papaya sauce. Perfect balance of sweet, sour, salty and spiciness. It's a pretty hefty price tag of $15 but well worth it. So suck it up and order it.   Nam Tok - it's a beef salad. Sliced grilled beef with a sweet and sour sauce including ground toasted rice for that extra umami flavor.   Lard na - stir fried wide rice noodles in a sweet gravy with veggies. This is similar to Pad se ewe except it has a gravy.   Pretty much all the dishes are delicious but those three are my go-to anytime I visit this place. Try it out!

eC8Kpp1uws56qMNiHhg3rA.text: My wife stumbled on reviews for this place so we decided to try it out. We have already been back a couple of times.    Service in each visit was helpful and fast.  We generally come for weekday lunches.  It seems there are several regular visitors as the staff knew some customers by name.  That is a great sign.    The menu is extensive and the various portion options make it easy to find the right fit for your appetite.  I loved the chicken curry (#4 spicy) which had amazing flavor, a nice heat (just a bit of forehead sweat), and fantastic texture.  The potato's and carrots were cooked perfectly.  The chicken was delicious.  This curry was amazing!  My wife has tried a few dishes and really enjoyed the pho, but everything was really good.  Like I said, we tried it on a whim and could not wait to go back.  The price was very good and this was a perfect meal for what we wanted.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pho ga (chicken pho)
Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States

nWBrDssRDc3EaCxCtpJidg.text: My boyfriend loves their Pad Thai Chicken. That's all he gets from here. I always get the Lad Nah.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pad Thai Chicken

rekxidtR5T9E4YU9v1XFBQ.text: True enjoy coming here with my family to this hidden gem. I will said that their food here is always great, authentic and fresh. Portions are generous which is a plus, it also reflects in it's price.   Soft drinks are non-refillable, water and tea it has refills. The chopsticks are not disposable, I actually preferred them. The bubble smoothie was a small, but really flavorful.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Majestic Mango bubble smoothie $5
Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States. #28
Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Different angle of #28

Vz4hJx1_VHq9SZJQ_3bVyg.text: Came here for dinner Friday night. When we arrived (7ish),  there were plenty of tables.  Tables started filling up shortly after though.  The space is pretty huge; there are plenty of tables for large groups.  We ordered a papaya salad to start. The salad was a bit different from what we are used to. It had a wedge of cabbage on the side which just seemed a bit of a waste and no peanuts which we really missed. Ive even had the salad with cashews before. Any nut would have been nice. The salad came with small fried shrimp on top.  That is also not something I was used to but they were surprisingly good.   We ordered the red curry and the yellow curry.  They curries tasted more like Indian curries than Thai curries to me but were pretty good. The portions were also very large.  So, you will not leave hungry but you will probably leave with leftovers. Recommendation: When you order Thai spicy,  it is really spicy so be prepared to handle it. I handle spicy pretty we but after 2 highly spicy dishes in a row,  my taste buds started to go numb.  That was my fault though... Need to know your limits.   Would return for the curry and would. Be interested in trying the pho/other Vietnamese dishes.   Service was decent. Prices were as would be expected in Charlotte.  Check out the pic!

photos.caption: Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Yellow and red curry
Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Papaya salad

pTxbUJLBb20M8jBKc1ZCoQ.text: It's been a few years since I've been to Viet-Thai and now that I've re-discovered it, I'm so happy! Even though I get take-out more than dining in, I love the vibe as soon as I walk in. It's calm, aromatic and the host and waiters are so nice. My all time favorite here is the Tom yum soup; probably the best I've had in Charlotte. My orders are always really basic and the food is always delicious. From the chicken satay to the pad Thai or the pho, you can't go wrong really. If a casual & comfortable dining experience is what you're looking for, this is the place to check out. If some soul satisfying Thai or Vietnamese food is what you're looking for, come here. It's a great place for family dinners with kids on a weeknight or the weekend.

ZYtPh4P9Fsk-C285xy5Ygg.text: Always a great meal here at Viet-Thai!! Service is always super fast and with a smile.  Extensive menu with many great choices. Never ordered something I didn't enjoy.  Tonight we opted for Chicken Satay (with awesome peanut sauce) and Spring Rolls for apps.  Dinner choice for me was my go-to Pad Thai.  The hubby's favorite is the Pho with Beef Tendon - served with the fresh herbs makes for a very aromatic dining experience.  Of course it's hard to turn down Thai Tea Smoothie w/ Bubbles.  This is truly our favorite Thai place in the Charlotte area.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Satay
Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Pad Thai
Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pho

Mg3IrDWSj79g37cmOCybng.text: MY FAVORITE Vietnamese food ever.  Amazing authentic food that is bursting with flavor.  Best waitstaff and owners.  You know it's the best place when you walk in and see many Vietnamese people there along with the locals.  It's nestled away behind a shopping center and is hard to find if you don't know about it.  My favorite restaurant period.

OXQ03yOh0Ji9m4Z2r2heqQ.text: A noodle house and I ended up ordering a rice dish. Oh, well.  A stir fry with chicken, the sauce was quite tasty. The veggies were still quite crisp and there was plenty of chicken. A bit of table sriracha and it was good to go.  I'll be back and probably order a curry dish with noodles next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Viet-Thai Noodle House on Pineville-Matthews Road
Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken curry at Viet-Thai Noodle House
Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Viet-Thai Noodle House on Pineville-Matthews Road

XYXhhGXyZkSotypGGjuTgA.text: There's a waitress that works here who is married to one of my dad's good friends, so I wanted to try the food here again. I went here back when I was in high school, but I hadn't been here in years until I heard it from the waitress.   When I was a teenager, I thought the food was good. I'm not sure if it just downgraded over time or my palette has improved over the years, but this place isn't as good as I remembered at all.   The Thai food is pretty good which I would recommend over the Vietnamese food here. They know how to cook Thai better. I recommend the red curry and Panang curry though I've had better Thai curries at other Thai restaurants in the Queen City.   Don't get the Vietnamese food here. The pho is decent, but the bun bo hue was not good. The meat was way too thick that I just ended up eating the noodles only and sipping the broth. And the bun thit ga had the same problem. The meat was also too thick and chewy.  One thing I really liked is their sweet tea which isn't the sweet tea you're used to at typical restaurants. It's Thai sweet tea and it tasted much better than the traditional sweet tea.   Service is also bad. There was this one waitress that was extremely rude and had a punchable face. We were wondering how she got the waitress job until we found out that it's a family business and she's part of the family. No wonder. The wife of my dad's friend was the only friendly person and gave us good service.

l3PBtgJNKEY0W9FT0dwvzg.text: YUM!  Viet-Thai Noodle House is a little hard to find if you are using your phone GPS. It brings you to the front of the structure, not their storefront. So, basically, park and walk, or explore on your own. It's directly behind Burlington Coat Factory.   We had a party of 6 and it was easy to get a table. No waiting necessary. This is a no-frills restaurant. If you're expecting decore, cute setting and romantic feel, this is not the place for you. They're all about the food.  Like I said, we had a party of 6, so I am pretty sure gratuity was included, but because I paid in cash, I was not given my receipt back. I think I left a double tip, which is why I am not giving 5 stars.   I ordered the Veg Pho. Awesome choice. Loaded with veggies and tofu. Wonderful flavor and a HUGE portion. I brought home leftovers.  The waitress was super accommodating and I requested no mushrooms in my vegetarian pho, and they made sure to put extra carrots in my order. Beyond the Veg Pho, there weren't too many options for veggies out there, but the pho is worth it, so give it a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tofu Pho

E_YMenIbKK5SiotcAH5IWw.text: This is my third visit to VTNH however, it is my first review. Nevertheless, each visit has been as pleasant as the first. This go around we had the Com Tom Thit Ga Nuog (grill chicken & shrimp), Pad Kee Mow noodles w/beef, Garbo Darby (red curry w/chicken) and Thi Fried Rice w/ chicken. All of the aforementioned dishes were as favorable as they were enjoyable however, if you really like "heat" I suggest that you share that bit of info in advance of placing your order. You will find VTNH is a great spot to bring the family (the little ones, the teens and adults) and everyone will leave feeling content and with smile on their respective faces.

yHLKkpgOUD4OIFipuAnZrw.text: It has been years since I have been here.  It's a great choice for VIET THAI food and is right off of Pineville-Matthews Road.  It's on the backside of the shopping center - a little bit tucked away.  I had the Pho Chicken soup with the noodles.  This dish is hard to mess up and they didn't.  My friend had beef served with rice.   He enjoyed it, but didn't seem to rave about it.  The service was almost too good.  They kept wanting to take our order and then cash out our tab.  They were being efficient, but didn't realize we were there to catch up with each other.  Their health grade was a 93.5, which was okay, but not as good as I like to see.  I am glad this restaurant is here.  It is clearly not a place that I come to often.  It doesn't make me jump up and down or squeal with every bite, but it's solid.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Qqqww

uZxw76dwt6mYMXhjxlA5Gg.text: I was so excited to satisfy my craving for dinner tonight... ordered to-go RIGHT at 5pm when they opened up. I hoped that meant my food would be fresher, before the dinner rush started. WRONG. They gave me Dried out chicken satay and shrimp sticks. I'm about 75% sure they were day old and reheated. The tofu was fresh and the egg roll was fresh, but the peanut sauce was watery and had an off flavor. Lastly, my husband's red curry was oily and watered down. I've never seen such a thin curry that didn't even coat the spoon or sides of the container. Shameful.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States

1Ew97Do5Xwpht1eVm2XG9A.text: The Food was Absolutely Delicious and service was Great....I highly recommend!!! I definitely give this restaurant a thumbs up and five stars. I will be coming back and sharing this spot with my friends and family!!

Di3twUyHYcS1w3R8iyCV8Q.text: I've been searching for great pho in the Carolinas and finally found it! Everything was good pho, summer rolls, and pad thai. The service was quick and friendly and the atmosphere was open and nice. This place all around hit all the marks!

laVZvFubY6qEqYH5GXawpQ.text: You will find solid, flavorful Thai and Vietnamese food here. I've never been disappointed with anything that I've ordered.

0u0VLtNz4KLDa7-vcApMng.text: First time - service was good. Food was good only thing I would say could be a little better was the flavor of the broth could have been more flavorful but all in all was good.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States

bstBKDJCV_xMKv3vkgAZFA.text: This a small gem that is fitting for 5 stars, The menu looks awesome and the prices a very reasonable. Is my first time visiting this place and the service was awesome and super nice ! I was feeling sick had a cold so I came to try out something other than boring ass chicken soup I tried out the pho soup with the meat balls and ordered  large  they give you this concentrated hot sauce( if I'm saying right ) lol  that way you control the level of how spicy you want your food to be. I'm glad this place is close to my job because for more on what's on that menu!!

photos.caption: Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pho soup is on point !
Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Amazing

5tdzqcAPPkHyWRESRpPKgg.text: Had the sukiyaki which was surprisingly good. One of the best rare steak I've had in noodle soup in a while. The broth was amazing with the peanut sauce and I'm still trying to figure out what was in there. If anyone knows how that broth is made please let me know, I miss it.

CrPEKBmY2j8SSsa6HUF9rg.text: So. Much. Yum... My first time trying pho was here and it was delectable. Their pad Thai with chicken and with the highest "level" of spicy-ness (??) is feckin amazing. Love this place. A lot.

IYyxI7exNwaRJB308ac0Nw.text: Have eaten here a few times.  Everything  has been great including service! Pho Ga (chicken soup) is my rainy/cool day favorite now and more healthy than other foods :-) Give them a try.

hLloRvqh71q764KLD9jy3g.text: I agree with the declarations that this is the best pho in Charlotte. What I expect out of a Vietnamese restaurant is fresh, crisp summer rolls, pho with fresh veggies and meats, plenty of noodles, and flavorful broth, and delicious vermicelli dishes. Viet-Thai Noodle House delivers on all of these! My boyfriend and I agree that their pho contains the most noodles and tastiest broth in all of Charlotte. I especially love their vegetarian pho: delicious veggies and perfectly cooked tofu. It can be rather difficult to find from the main road, but it is certainly worth it to make the trip! And even when they're busy, we've never had to wait long for a table. This place tops the list! I have yet to try any of their Thai items - the Vietnamese food is what I go for!

Y9k3zrKrdt1J2rJvnhyM6g.text: One of the best places to get a bowl of PHO' in Charlotte.  I love going to this place.   My recommendation (along with the combination PHO') is the beef or chicken larb dish.  Try it.....I'm almost positive you will enjoy it.

bk4aQttZsRNv5XcMYLDqSg.text: Of all the Thai places I've tried in Charlotte, this one is my favorite.  It's located in the back of a strip mall area so it's a little tricky to get to it but it's well worth it.  It's open every day of the week but Monday!   One of the best things about this place is the people who run it.  They are very friendly and offer great recommendations if you are interested in being adventurous when browsing the extensive menu.  The folks here are also very flexible and can customize the dishes to suite your taste.  They take great pride in their food and it shows!  I've ordered both Vietnamese and Thai dishes here and have always been really happy with what I picked.  Everything is fresh and full of flavor.  Some of the dishes are enormous and you will have plenty left over to take home, but there are also lighter options.  The menu, again, is extensive so if you can't find something that looks appealing then I don't know what else to tell you! I've been told that the food is as close to authentic as you will find in Charlotte.  Given the outstanding service, great food, and reasonable prices, this place tops my list of Thai restaurants.

-MFgY6s2U3D2Ko_f4R6XVg.text: Hands down the best pho. Don't let the strip mall appearance fool you. I keep going back for more.

LOtHKtXT-MBfa7oe8pJGSw.text: It wasn't bad and it wasn't really good either. Pho broth was just average. Chicken curry with lemongrass had no lemongrass flavor. Summer fresh roll was fill with too much lettuce and lacked overall flavor. Good service.

EuIactwRj9GDl7k2SphQuw.text: My beautiful wife asked for Viet-Thai takeout as her first real meal after delivering both of our children.  These meals were a big deal for her, a personal celebration.     When a pregnant woman picks the same place twice for what she really wants after labor, you know there is something special about the food.  Outstanding pho dishes, always pleasant staff.  Only minor critique is the decor could use a refresh perhaps for dining in.

rEzDZe8kg6dGEQkJMSkjIA.text: Excellent PHO and the best spring rolls!  All around a very good menu with good pricing.

ISgMG2Ax44LBfd9eaDKd-w.text: Quaint, authentic, whole in the wall. Absolutely amazing food - coconut boba tea and Pho Thai are to die for. Fantastic & friendly, such a good find!

VIbYdD1ERYNyLHcHtXdCcg.text: Viet Thai has incredible, authentic food. Their soups are delicious, always hot and fresh tasting (and quick if you're wanting a to-go order). #92 is my favorite, chicken, cashews, pineapple and loads of fresh veggies - get it spicy (they offer spices on a scale of 1-5 stars or will bring you a spice rack if you're daring). Everyone I have taken with me has loved their dishes as well. The Vietnamese dishes are just as tasty as the Thai dishes if you're looking for something a little different. Very fast and courteous service!

0-ENS8QnFsCOOAk-1-kFFg.text: Good Pho, I like that you have a few choices on whats going in the soup.

3HjXQKZwVbzxRGfWusdn1w.text: Great food,amazing taste!  Try the pad thai and fried rice with thai tea.  Took 1 star off the rating because of the wait time!

Z4WOOGtej2fzodKLsk6T0A.text: Shocked! Probably the best Pho I've had in a very long time. The restaurant doesn't look like much from the outside, but inside, it's fabulous. The funny thing is that everyone there was busy eating and watching the Olympic Trials. Hardly anyone was conversing! That's generally a good sign with how food tastes.   Ordered Veggie/Tofu Pho and loved it. Be sure to ask for some Chili sauce to further enhance the overall flavor. TRUST ME!   RECOMMENDATION: Try the Thai Iced Tea. Excellent!   The staff is incredibly friendly. In fact, we ordered a Medium Pho for two people, and they accidentally gave us a Large with no extra charge. Refilled drinks frequently.   Great place for a date.  Update: I've been here four times since.

nGCGj_zev6bdjhz63G9VCw.text: The staff is amazing and very attentive. The place is clean. Two reasons for the lower stars - $13 for a large bowl of pho is a ripoff and the broth is ok but less than authentic. My search continues in the Queen City....

_7sUupbip2WNGOfP9xFKcA.text: My husband and I went here mainly because they had bubble tea, but were more pleased with the food! I had Pho and it was full of flavor, fresh tasting and a huge portion! My husband got a Thai dish that set him on fire but in a good way! The staff was very friendly and the atmosphere was good. Not the best decor but easy and relaxed. We will definitely go back when in Charlotte.

ADD-tGybtwGagT-AxQoSwA.text: Good eats are often hard to find, and Viet-Thai is a treasure you don't want to miss. They have something for everyone, from light soup noodles to hearty stir-fried dishes packed with a smattering of meats, seafood, and vegetables. The atmosphere is casual yet classy, and the service is astounding. It's best to come with a large group so you can sample the many different tastes and textures Viet-Thai has to offer.

nQSTXoH0SL6shRfL0bnw3A.text: We absolutely LOVE this place and have eaten here a number of times but tonight was VERY frustrating.. They were so busy, which we understand, but the waitress said maybe 2 words to us, never came to check on us, took 10 minutes to even get water, AND didn't tell us that she was not even bringing our check to the table so made us wait 15 minutes before we sought her out. When we were here last our service was great but this was a huge disappointment.. The food was still good so I gave 3 instead of 2 stars.

eJfTtbO9jC0dnDFhRbfkqg.text: Good quality food,  nice and attentive hosts,  keep checking with you.  Food served quickly

eSSf_PFnChEsKCL5XlrcjA.text: The food is always Phenominal! The customer service is always great. I've been here plenty of times and they always treated me very well!

qnH021j9gZKjpXsluTXo9w.text: Took us a while to find this place, but it did not disappoint me.  These are real foods of the real taste. Thai tea here is super amazing, i havent had for years. Other restaurants obviously been used powder and hurted my throat; and their meals are for good looking, so little, i was never full. The price here is little higher than other places but the meal they brought out is enough to make you full. I can actually call it a human's meal. Because other restaurants brought out so little. I hated it when they close at 3-5pm. But definitely will come back! Good services, good foods, good looking. Love it!

f__hew-5WzXXl7SZc5an8A.text: Love Thai food and this is the good stuff.  Friendly staff, huge menu.  Our party of 11 adults all had different items and all received high marks.  The Google pin on the map is slightly off and will mislead you.  This place is in a small shopping center right across from the main parking lot of Lowes across the street.    Fantastic all around.

x7Z4e5_SsrfwiLI2wwV80A.text: I love this place, certainly one of the best Thai places in Charlotte, and I go there every week (sometimes more than once ;-) The food is fresh and authentic, comes out quickly, and the service is great! They have a bunch of sauces on the table and will bring more if you want. They have no problem modifying the dishes to your preference, and always remember just how I like things. I can attest to what the other reviewer said, be ready for some heat if you ask for a "10" on the spiciness! My favorite dish is the Pad Kee Mao and my wife loves the Pad Thai. If you love Thai, you have to give this place a try!

uJDR24mxPuBjRVwwDS47uw.text: The food was good if you plug your nose and close your eyes.  The restaurant smells bad and the fish tank is way over due for a scrubbing. The water is as old as the carpet.  Not appetizing to see gigantic gold fish slugging around in a dirty tank while trying to enjoy a meal.  It's not cheap by any means either.

np7y_augD5_8swiuy_DdjA.text: Great Thai food! Had the Red Curry with Chicken! Oh boy is it good! It the right kind of hot, where you don't think it's hot until you finish eating and you are sweating! A must for Thai fans!

vgfAGDTLJ7avIdmAZgWb7A.text: Love. Love. Love. We go once a month for summer rolls, waterfall, and pho. It is always fresh and amazing. We also order take out regularly- summer rolls and Thai basil fried rice. Viet-Thai is one of my fav spots in Charlotte!

KbCC5swnYbLXc6VjmvGsFA.text: Excellent food and friendly service.  Excellent pho noodle soup and Pad Thai.

sB6mzgZlzp9mf9nfNXPoEw.text: Not easy to find. In the back of a shopping center. In went there for Pho all the time. It's the closest I can find to the noodle I had home in China.

osRNHCuUVFjEU6-UV2kClQ.text: I stepped into another world eating the food at Viet-Thai. I am always looking to one up the spring roll and soup challenge and sure enough both the soup and rolls had my mouth watering for more. I could not get enough of the peanut dipping sauce and the large slices of ginger in their shrimp tom yum soup. The shrimp spring rolls were awesome with the fresh taste of basil, lemongrass and of course shrimp (none of the sketchy sorts either) . The rolls were large for an appetizer s a plus if you want to share a minus if you don't. I decided to be stingy and keep both for myself. Onto the amazing soup again good portion size at this point I was getting stuffed but I forged on in my quest to finish the entire bowl. Can we say fresh shrimp, large mushrooms, tomatoes, ginger, lemongrass and that drink it from the bowl sweet and sour broth? As always service was prompt and attentive but hey I could get 3/4 of the way through my water glass before it was refilled. Bonus. I cannot say good enough things about this place. I wish I had room for the Vietnamese coffee but that may have sent me over the edge.

y8qw5lqKFn-owoynZOw7yQ.text: Finally a place that has Boba! After moving here from California I never thought I'd see it again. I went in on a Friday night for take out. After going to the wrong shopping center I finally found it and I was not disappointed. The atmosphere was very cozy. I ordered yellow curry with tofu and Thai boba (known here as bubble tea). The hostess was very nice and greeted me as I walked in and promptly offered me a menu. I had looked at the menu online but had some questions and she patiently answered all of them. In less than 10 minutes I was in and out with my order. I took a sip of the boba and was in heaven! The tea was fresh and had the perfect amount of spices. The curry was delicious! She warned me it would be spicy and boy was she right, but that's why I got the tea. Will defiantly be going back to try the other flavors of boba as well as other menu items. A must try if you love Thai and Vietnamese food!

vlVaMNH6jEDQf_Nv_T3qig.text: Love Phoe soup but very particular of how it should taste. Viet-Thai hits it right on the nose!  Finally after searching throughout Charlotte, we found a place that KNOWS how to make Phoe soup. Thanks Viet-Thai!

_b63w24app78wrvwJavtbg.text: AMAZING pho!  I always eat here when I'm in the area; the food is consistently delicious and reasonably priced.

wCx73QR6e1EyQZ0_PR0oWQ.text: I had lunch at the Viet-Thai Noodle house late on a Sunday afternoon, about 2pm.  The atmosphere is very nice, typical Asian decor, clean and well maintained.  The place was pretty empty, there was only one other party there when I came in.  I ordered the summer rolls, goi cuon, & pho tai, rare beef with green onions and cilantro.  The pho comes in 3 sizes medium, large, and XL.  I ordered the XL, being an XL guy.  The summer rolls came out very quickly.  The rice paper wrapper was sticky and chewy, nice compliment to crunch of the fresh vegetables inside.  The peanut sauce was excellent.  The rolls were enormous and reasonably priced, $3.75 for an order of two.  I don't know if the staff waited til I finished my summer rolls or it was just a coincidence, but my server brought the pho tai out a couple of minutes after I finished them.  I dumped the bean sprouts and jalapenos right into the steaming hot soup then added some basil leaves and lime juice.  The broth was steaming hot and had a nice rich flavor.  I didn't have them spice the soup up, so I added a generous shot of srichacha sauce to give it some kick.  I have tried eating the noodled with chop sticks and usually windup wearing more than I eat, so I stuck with a fork.  The beef was tender and delicious.  With the restaurant being pretty empty the service was excellent, very friendly and making sure I had everything I needed.  I got the feeling though if the place was busier that the service would still be excellent.  The prices are very reasonable, being about the same as most places I have visited while I have been here in Charlotte (the XL Pho Tai was $9.50).   I will definitely come back here to try the Pad Thai and other items.

smaQJQAVjsAjzlSi4mp6Sg.text: Viet-Thai is not the easiest place to find, but I'm glad we did.  My wife loves exotic foods and enjoys the more interesting options on the menu.  I'm more plain and stick to the fried rice type options.  At Viet-Thai, she's jealous of my dish every time!  Sure, her curry is always good, but the Thai Fried Rice is out of this world full of flavor and a nice level of spice.

98DRnfVsbg0VAtSoo8yNzg.text: I ordered the strawberry bubble tea, and the Pad Kee Mow. This was my first time ordering Thai food, so I had no idea what to expect. My order was a huge portion ( for me at least).  The menu said it  was prepared with a spicy brown sauce, but the sauce wasn't spicy. It was still great though. My boyfriend ordered the yellow curry and that was tasty as well. The staff was very nice and the restaurunt wasn't very crowded. Can't wait to try some of the other dishes I saw people ordering!!

WKzSPVmpmzlHA-_76guOAA.text: Viet-Thai Noodle House is tucked away around the back of McMullen Creek Shopping Center and from the outside you would probably think it was closed.  When you walk inside it's pretty dark, all of the windows are covered with white curtains which I think is nice so you aren't looking at a bunch of cars in the parking lot while you're eating.  The menu is pretty big and they serve Vietnamese, Thai and, if you ask them for it, they also have a limited menu of Lao food (the owners are actually from Laos).  Since these 3 countries are all so close to each other in Southeast Asia their cuisines share some similarities and they use similar ingredients.  I've only tried their Vietnamese food, so far, and it is very good.  I tried a couple different rice dishes which were prepared well with really fresh vegetables.  Their pho is also prepared well and comes out very quick!  Another thing they have is bubble tea with all different kinds of flavors, green tea is my favorite, a nice treat to end a good meal with!

hwj6MZhmGjkCjbOPQhS1GA.text: Went here on my way through town. Very good food.  Service was quick, plenty of meat in my Pad Thai and good spice. Highly recommend

sEc1Zfevz3UyrsJRgyXuxw.text: This place has great  food. The thai was good, the Vietnamese was  outstanding. Prices are pretty cheep. Try the Ginger tea.

QLXzLV_8OD5fuqk0YXFjew.text: OK. So i wrote a review last year and had to delete it bc this is my favorite place and i have tasted different things on the menu. I have become a regular and will drive miles to have the best pad thai, pho, and great friendly staff in town. I have bought friends to this restaurant bc of the food.   My regulars are: pad thai pad sawee thai tea with boba papaya salad (spicy please!)  Pho (with everything!) viet or thai fried rice egg rolls  taro smoothie with boba ...  Toni is the best waitress. She is always in smiles!   ALSO the place is hard to find. DO NOT BE CONFUSED WITH THAI HOUSE. !!!   Viet-thai noodle house is behind Burlington coat factory, in front of lowes. Different parking lot.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States

gxM4ll9vnPRN4e80kzCQSg.text: Do not ever get the Bun Bo Hue there. It was THE worst Bun Bo Hue I have ever had. It tasted nothing like Bun Bo Hue. I'm Vietnamese, I know this lol. The broth had this ginger taste that was so odd. It was just bad... Asked the owner and she said that was their recipe! Lol I don't know where that recipe came from but definitely not from Vietnam.

Mc3oTG5KtSLPHD5HWwWFPQ.text: Been here a few times in the past couple of months for dine in and takeout. Staff was friendly, the various dishes have been pretty solid. Wifey always orders the Thai tea, and the red curry has good flavor and heat.  Solid enough food to keep us coming back.

MJ_qLsSWhH69mRR0HermVA.text: What a wonderful place. The decor is authentic and the atmosphere is delightfully appropriate for the genre.   And the food? It was splendid. They have a wide variety of both Vietnamese and Thai dishes, all very fresh, flavorful, and the portions were very generous.   Spice aficionados will also have their cravings satisfied here - they can make just about any dish as spicy as you can tolerate it ; )  The server was very nice, attentive, and accommodating.   I'll most certainly be coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Viet Thai combo appetizer.
Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Thai Iced tea - large portions!

G6bloEd_iJS8esAMIos9FA.text: Omg. Just ate here. Amazing, friendly, and fast service. Great little spot. Officially one of my new regular places. I've eaten at Basil downtown before but this place definitely beats them, in my opinion.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pad see-ew with Tofu added. Amazing!

A2KRPuXBmsWcTHdq84dJNw.text: There aren't too many ways to mess up Vietnamese food in my opinion, so I must say I enjoyed my visit.  I ordered the friend noodles and tofu with mixed veggies. It was heavy on the onions, but other than that I enjoyed the dish.  The noodles seemed to be a bit overcooked and were almost mushy, but that didn't stop me from eating nearly all of it.  To help with the heat of the dish, I ordered the pineapple smoothie, but it tasted very chalky and artificial, so I wouldn't recommend it.  I'll definitely be returning to the Noodle House.

bbL9CZ5ghxLqHZXsp0tRxQ.text: Cold day, sniffles, craving something warm to eat. Hark!  Hot noodle soup. Yes, I must have it, but where?  How about the well-reviewed hole-in-the-wall place behind the Burlington coat factory?  I'm game.  It has all the kitschy indicia of a place that focuses only on good authentic food, while sparing the expense of decor, location, etc. I came for noodle soup and damn if they didn't deliver. This was savory, fresh, with tender steak and perfect noodles.  A few drops of sriracha and it was a nearly perfect hot noodle soup experience. They even made our two your old a "kids size" bowl, which was bigger than my head. All around great food, great service and we will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cece enjoying her giant &#34;kids size&#34; noodle soup.

Eqoggee88rU_JM5Lc7w2cw.text: It is a nice restaurant with ample parking in a safe location. They have both Vietnamese and Thai dishes on their menu. I'd say that they are trying to be creative in their dishes. Maybe I was in the mood for a more traditional dish, but I didn't really care for their deconstructed Panang curry (see picture). And it's the first time I've had Panang curry with peas and steamed broccoli. Certainly more healthy, but not what if call traditional. I asked for it to be Thai hot. It was more like cautious American-Thai hot. So, overall it's decent food, but just not doing it for me as a traditionalist.

photos.caption: Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Panang curry
Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Jasmine tea service
Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Thai coffee

QhvJvdKJIWHawfzrVk1fxg.text: I can't speak highly enough about this restaurant. Immaculately clean, wonderfully fresh ingredients, friendly staff & reasonable prices. My Pho, loaded w/ proteins was complemented by a poached egg to thicken the broth. Haven't seen that since visiting New York.

IIxMNpregQLLr3yXgcdQRg.text: Disappointing. First time trying this place and I ordered the Pad Thai for carry out. There were no prices on-line and with the small portion size I was very surprised with the price. The dish itself was not great. The noodles seemed a bit burnt, there was barely any sauce, no peanut flavor at all. Will be looking for another go-to Thai place.

ZpBwU79eM4vmb34RRu7DOw.text: When Viet Thai first opened many moons ago, we went barreling in  one evening and what I remember was it being newly painted, sparse and no alcohol license yet.  So a group of eight, turned around to leave, my mom tells the man, "we come back when you have alcohol."  I thought good lord, let me get this woman out of here!  I decided to give it a try yesterday, it looked totally different from my first visit. The two people were working were pleasant and efficient.  I ordered fresh rolls and vermicelli with pork.  There is something very addictive in Vietnamese food, maybe it's the cilantro and mint or the fish sauce, but you can bet, I want to eat there again today.  And yes, mama, they do have alcohol, it's safe to return.

uepvBDSTRABnoYbh6bZqTw.text: Best place in charlotte!!! Food is always excellent and staff is super friendly and helpful! There's a super attractive woman named Tumi who always remembers my family's order and greets us by name. Love the right knit family feel and clean atmosphere

dIwqm29nmRxmV3eXkQf4UA.text: Somewhat hidden behind a larger shopping center on Pineville Matthews, it is closer to the Lowes.  Very good Vietnamese food, I've tried a few dishes and enjoyed them all. Service is very fast and the waiters are all attentive (there are so many of them stopping by almost every 3-4 minutes). The prices are rather low as well. We will keep coming back.

0apnMGkLfzUPkVGHVfhwGw.text: Food is overpriced and on top of that it was not good! Go somewhere where the price is reasonable and the quality is good. I would not recommend this place to anyone.

RtwmMscHmCptBNJUrthBSw.text: Viet Thai is located on the side of the mall closest to Lowes. It's a dimly lit restaurant that honestly looks really shady, but its in a strip mall with a parking lot. When I walked in, it was also pretty quiet and there was plenty of tables and booths open.  Surprisingly, this is probably as good as it gets in Charlotte for both Vietnamese and Thai food! Who woulda guessed, right? I had my doubts, as a place claiming to serve both Vietnamese and Thai food which are extremely different types of food. I think the owners are Vietnamese, but contrary to most others, they are extremely nice. When they added peanuts to the Pad Thai I ordered with NO PEANUTS, they remade it without any complaints.  Spring Rolls - Would get again. They are HUGE!  The Pad Thai is DELISH and comes in hearty portions. The noodles and the flavor and sauce are all right on point. Perfectly cooked every single time! Note: if you like spicy, ask for it extra spicy because "mild" is so mild that you can't taste the spice.  The Pho Ga (Chicken) is also really good and has a tasty broth. The large/small didn't seem much different in size (stick with the small).  The Pad See Ew - I've had better noodles, I like them more delicate.  Pad Kee Mao - The mild was SO spicy! They use the same noodles as the Pad See Ew, and Lard Na. It was alright but I think one order isn't enough to fill me up. Needs more noodles.  Bun Bo Hue - Spicy Beef Noodle Soup. I liked that they were really generous with the meat. But like the Pad See Ew, there weren't enough noodles. The noodles were really interesting, most people use pho noodles, but these were white round rice noodles, kinda chewy and bouncy. Would return for this when I'm craving beef.  Black Milk Tea with Boba - SKIP! Tastes like soap, probably because they use jasmine tea or something. The bubble drinks here are made with powder, so I would not recommend the fruit ones.  Vietnamese Iced Coffee - SO GOOD. and they give you alot too!

photos.caption: Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bun Bo Hue
Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pad Kee Mao
Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Medium Chicken Pho

ovxsGfjozj4ygViJyAi-rw.text: Pho! Bubble Tea! Happiness!  I've been here a few times during my travels to Charlotte.  I had the 48. Pho Tai Gan Sach which has rare beef and tendon. I had the XL size and it was just the right amount of food for me. Maybe a little too much, but better safe than sorry. The beef and tendons were wonderful.  If you like your food spicy, ask for the spicy chili oil. It's delicious. Only takes a few drops in your soup to get it really kickin.  Sadly, they ran out of bubbles at the time of night we were there. Ultimate sadness. So we had to share one bubble tea. We had the melon slushi and it wasn't bad. The bubbles were a just little bland compared to what I'm used to and a little hard. But overall the tea was good. I'd get it again.  Service was really good and always is. Our waiter was attentive and very nice.

jj6osFcr3vusraQo0usAuQ.text: So excited to try another great Thai restaurant in town! Doing our normal Saturday routine and scouring Yelp for lunch options. Very happy to find Viet-Thai at the top of our nearby options!  This little place is tucked discretely in the McMullen Creek Shopping Center. If you are entering from Johnston, it's caddy corner from Lowe's and near Curves. Better to enter from Johnston than 51. You'll see it much better upon entering.   The menu is ENORMOUS. Much like other Thai/vietnamese restaurants in town there are so many options. We started out with bubble tea! So happy that there is a place to grab bubble tea in south Charlotte. We tried mango and taro. Both delicious and refreshing. $0.50 extra for tapioca pearls. Kind of a bummer but not enough to stop us!  The summer rolls are perfect. Got both tofu and shrimp. Packed full of vermicelli, cilantro, carrots and lettuce. The peanut sauce accompaniment is very welcoming. I recommend adding a little sriracha to the mix. Your taste buds will thank you later. Freshness beyond comparison.   My wife got vegetarian pad Thai. Sweet, smoky and well-balanced. A rather generous portion, to boot. Choc a bloc filled with bamboo shoots. This dish would be perfect with an added protein is just fine sans.   I tried the #83 (the name escapes me) with medium spicy sauce. You can ask for Thai spicy, but beware Viet-Thai lovers. It's a force to be reckoned with. My entree was filled with sweet sauteed green and red peppers, onions and wide cut rice noodles. Matched with chicken and a sweet soy base. Compounding spice factor throughout my enjoyment and, boy, was it intense! I couldn't imagine any spicier. They serve your entree with ornate chopsticks, as well. Perfect for you noodle-goers. Loved every bite and intermittently sipped bubble tea and water to ward off the capsaicin onslaught!  Viet-Thai is absolutely wonderful. The staff is friendly and rather helpful with the menu.   Prices are very fair for lunch. We ended up with a $38 bill after all of the above. Could be much cheaper, too! No complaints.   If you like Thai, Vietnamese or Mao cuisine, this should be bookmarked for you to try asap!  Solid 4.5 of 5!

photos.caption: Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States. #83 medium spicy
Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp summer rolls
Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tofu summer rolls

IYgHQQ5oWFTP5yM7P21ECg.text: I gave this place a try. I have to say the pho is kind of expensive here. But compared to other Vietnamese restaurants I guess the prices are comparable to others but being that I am from the west coast where the prices are below $10. I am reluctant to give this place above 2 stars. Although the flavor is very spot on to the actual flavors in Vietnam. Just the prices is keeping me from scoring no more than 2 stars. If the prices were below $10 definitely this place will receive at least 4 stars.

5aR4qynuJdU3hvzqjuVDoA.text: Yeah, I knew I'd like this place the minute I walked in.  Decor is cozy and kind of dated but comfortable.  Staff is immediately friendly and show you to a table immediately.  Service is fast at lunch, and pace of the meal is perfect.  It's great!  We started with summer rolls, which are HUGE, and come 2 per order.  It is like eating a salad!  What a great start! I then had the Pho Tai (with rare beef, white onions and cilantro).  The pho broth is good, and the beef is tender.  They could probably get away with half as much bean sprouts per order, but I appreciate the generous serving.  Even though we were stuffed (how do you somehow get stuffed from soup and salad in rice paper?...), we couldn't resist "bubble tea" to go.  We tried the taro bubble tea with big tapioca in the bottom.  Oh, man - what an interesting treat!  I will order it again next time I go, which will most likely be next week!

6bI4c_obT-24KLcqyVlNGw.text: I have eaten here several times now and every time the food is hot and delicious. I especially love the Thai Tea and Tofu Pad Thai. My boyfriend always gets the Pho special and it is also amazing. Oh and the Tom Yum soup...OMG amazing on a cold day. This place is perfect for all the Thai food lovers out there.

Photo of Viet-Thai Noodle House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crispy Spring Rolls
